Now, she has requested help. She hopes the Kiva lenders can help support her so that she can improve the pens for the guinea pigs she raises. Her dream is to improve her sales and to continue growing her business.

loan.use: with the improvements on the pen for her guinea pigs.

loan.name: Silvana Elizabeth Alarcon Toaza

texts.es: Silvana es una mujer de30 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su bazar y venta de ropa. Su historia empez su negocio con un capital que le regalo su mama por lo que lo ubico en su mismo domicilio debido a que tiene escuelas cercanas decidi ponerse un bazar, su trabajo lo hace sola desde las 7:00 hasta las 21:00, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no est casada, no tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es desear adquirir un local en la baha para venta de ropa y tener casa propia. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su bazar y venta de ropa y asi comprar zapatillas, utiles de oficina, papeleria.
texts.en: Silvana is a 30 year old woman and she has many aspirations for the coming years, one of them being that her bazaar and clothing business prospers. She started her business with capital that her mother gave to her. She runs her business from her house and decided to put her bazaar there, as there are many schools close by. She works alone, from seven in the morning til nine at night. She has trouble with crime in the area. She is not married and doesn't have any children. Her most important dream is to obtain a shop on the bay to sell clothes and have her own home. She wants to use the loan to buy shoes, office supplies and stationary for her bazaar and clothing shop.

loan.use: buy shoes, office supplies and stationary.

loan.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, aged 31, is married to Joseph and is blessed with three children. She sells clothes and has been doing this for five years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kshs. 60,000.
This is her seventh loan term with KADET Ltd and she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to pay the school fees for her children. Ruth hopes to open a boutique in the future.

loan.use: To buy four bales of ladies clothes, two bales of children wear and 20 pieces of mens jeans.

loan.name: Magdalina

texts.en: Magdalina is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Magdalina has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Magdalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Magdalina hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Amancio

texts.en: Amancio is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children. Amancio has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 12,000 to buy stocks of bananas to sell. Amancio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amancio hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of bananas to sell.

loan.name: Vincent

texts.en: The welding metals business has been the main primary source of Vincents family. He is 50 years old and married with three children. He is thankful because through this business, he has sent his children to school. He would like to develop his business in order to gain more profit, but because of deficiencies in working capital, Vincent is requesting a loan of P25,000, which will be used in buying equipment such as a welding machine, barrena and other necessities. Hopefully, with this new equipment he will be able to provide high quality of service to his customers and at the same time he will be able to ensure a good stability of living for his family.

loan.use: buying equipment such as a welding machine, barrena and other necessities.

loan.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin de 44 aos de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cnyuge y su hijo menor de dos aos de edad. All en esta hermosa e histrica ciudad, se dedica al oficio de carpintera; actividad que inici cuando trabajaba en una ebanistera hace 15 aos; como le gust mucho este oficio, se propuso estudiar arquitectura y as empez a mejorar su trabajo, ganando mucho reconocimiento, por eso decidi independizarse y en su propia casa emprendi su propio negocio en un taller, comprando poco a poco las herramientas y los equipos necesarios para hacerlo. En este taller le ha ido muy bien y sus planes de crecimiento son muchos, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para hacerlo, tan pronto como l quiere. Esta es la razn por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprar materias pri,as e insumos para fabricar nuevos diseos, como madera pinturas, lacas pegantes, puntillas taches, y tambin invertir un poco en hacer adecuaciones a su taller, poniendo plantilla al piso y una cubierta que le permita trabajar en mejores condiciones especialmente en la poca de lluvias. Su meta mas adelante es lograr compras en volmenes importantes para obtener buenos descuentos y por eso se preparar en cada uno de los financiamientos que realice a esta organizacin.
texts.en: Edwin, 44, lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and their 2 year-old child. There, in this beautiful and historic city, he works as a carpenter. He started this business 15 years ago when he was working in a cabinetmaking shop. Since he really enjoyed this trade, he had the idea of studying architecture, and so he began to improve his work. Over time, he became quite well-known, and so he decided to start working independently in his own home. He started up his own business in a workshop, gradually buying the tools and equipment he needed. His workshop has done very well, and he has a lot of expansion plans, but he lacks sufficient working capital to implement these plans as quickly as he would like. This is the reason that he came to seek a Kiva loan. This will be his first loan from the Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, and with it he will buy supplies and raw materials so that he can make some new designs, such as wood, paint, lacquer, glue, tacks and screws, and he will also invest some of the money in making some improvements to his workshop. He will put in new wood flooring and will also add a roof that will allow him to work in better conditions, especially during the rainy season. His goal for the future is to make his important purchases in bulk so he can obtain a good discount. To do this, he will prepare to participate in each loan cycle offered by this institution.

loan.use: to buy wood, paint, lacquer, glue, tacks and screws, and also to make some small improvements to his workshop

loan.name: Edwin Wanyoike Njoki

texts.en: Edwin is 27 years old, he runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for one year and has employed 3 people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a bull for slaughter.

loan.use: To buy a bull for slaughter.

loan.name: Gladis Ubel

texts.es: La Seora Gladis, se dedicada a su pequeo negocio de venta de churros, pan, confites, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacin en la ciudad de Choluteca, desde hace mas de 5 aos, tambin vende productos de belleza como ser, cremas, tratamientos, maquillaje y otros para poder obtener otros ingresos, gracias a las utilidades obtenidas ha logrado salir adelante con sus dos hijos los que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. Esta solicitando crdito por valor de L. 8,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de churros, confites, pan y productos de belleza.
texts.en: Seora Gladis makes her living with a small business selling churros (a doughnut-like treat), bread and candies. She has been running the business out of her home, located in the city of Choluteca, for more than 5 years. She also sells beauty products, like lotions, treatments, make-up and other items, to increase her income. Thanks to the profits she has earned, she and her two children, who attend the local school, have been able to get ahead. Seora Gladis is requesting a loan of L. 8,000.00 (USD $425) to invest in the purchase of churros, candies, bread and beauty products.

loan.use: to purchase churros (a doughnut-like treat), candies, bread and beauty products for her business.

loan.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 57 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar en su tienda.
Su historia empez con pocas cosas pero poco a poco fue creciendo en su negocio, su trabajo lo hace sola todas las tardes, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, est casada, tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es tener un poco ms grande su tienda y de este momento sobrevivir. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su tienda y asi comprar enlatados, bebidas, confites etc.
texts.en:
Ana is a 57-year-old woman who has many aspirations of prospering her store within the next few years. Her story starts out with her having only a few things and gradually her business grew. She works alone every afternoon. The difficulties she faces include dealing with crime. Ana is married and has children.

Her greatest dream is to have a larger store, which is surviving at the moment. For this reason, this loan will be used to buy canned goods, beverages, candies, and other products for her store.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, candies, and other products.

loan.name: Estephania Yuliana

texts.es: Estephania es una mujer de 25 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su venta de ropa su historia empez porque la necesidad lo obligo a incurrir en otra actividad entonces una amiga le comento sobre la ropa por catalogo, su trabajo lo hace sola todas las tardes, tiene dificultades, no est casada, tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es tener su negocio amplio y hacer su casa. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Estephania is a 25 year old woman who has many aspirations for the upcoming years for the success of her clothing sales.
She fell into the activity of clothing sales out of necessity, and then a friend told her about clothing catalogs. She works alone every afternoon and has some difficulties; she is not married and has children.
Estephania's most important dream is to grow her business and make her home, which is why she wants the loan for her clothing sales.

loan.use: to sell clothing, shirts, and pants.

loan.name: Mercy Cristina

texts.es: Mercy es una mujer de 42 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su bazar su historia empez hace 15 aos con la venta de un vehculo y poco a poco creci ella empez como empleado y decidi poner su propio bazar, su trabajo lo hace sola se levanta a las 6:00 enva a sus hijos a la escuela y abre, tiene dificultades es la delincuencia, est casada su esposo es distribuidor de agua por pomas, si tiene3 hijos, su sueo ms importante es que sus hijos terminen la universidad y terminar de construir su casa. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su bazar y asi comprar cuadernos, perfumes y ropa.
texts.en: Mercy, 42, has great hopes that her bazaar will prosper in the coming years. Her story began 15 years ago with the sale of a vehicle; little by little things grew. She started as an employee and decided to open up her own bazaar. She works alone, getting up at 6:00 in the morning to see her children off to school and open the store. Her main challenge is crime. She is married; her husband is a water distributor. They have 3 children. Her biggest dreams are for her children to graduate from college, and to finish building her house. For that reason she wants a loan for her bazaar so that she can buy notebooks, perfumes and clothing.

loan.use: to buy notebooks, perfumes and clothing.

loan.name: Victor Manuel Jimenez Morales

texts.es: Vctor es un hombre de 29 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su servicio de taxi su historia empez hace 6 aos de actividad en el negocio de taxi cooperativa, su trabajo lo hace solo, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no est casado, no tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es poder contribuir para terminar la vivienda que est en construccin. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su servicio de taxi y poder pagar el permiso de placa para su auto y asi seguir trabajando ya que sin eso no puede conducir el vehiculo.
texts.en: Victor is a twenty-nine year old man and has many aspirations for the next few years. He wants his taxi service to thrive. He started to work for the taxi cooperative six years ago. He works by himself and has trouble with delinquency. He is not married and doesn't have children. His most important dream is to contribute to the completion of his house, which is under construction. He wants the loan for his taxi service and to pay for the license plate for his taxi and in this way continue working, as he would not be able to without it.

loan.use: pay for his license plate

loan.name: Rosario Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario tiene 42 aos no es casada pero convive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 18 ao y 23 aos, se dedica ala venta de artesanas, se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 5 aos, este prstamo es la primera secuencia que tiene con la institucin, la Sra. Carolina invertir este prstamo en la compra de una moto para poder transportarse de un lugar a otro llevando sus mercadera y as poder tener mas venta y generar mas ingresos, la Sra. Rosario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son los viajes que debe de realizar a la ciudad de La Paz para la compra de sus productos ya que ella vende artesanas no las hace compra hechas y utilizara los beneficios del crdito dndole un medio de trabajo para su hijo ya que el le ayuda bastante en la compra de los productos, el deseo de la Sra. Rosario suea con crecer en su negocio y poder comprarse un propio local para poder vender mejor su artesana, y as lograr tener mas ingresos y poder terminar de cancelar su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosario is 42 years old, and is not married but lives with her partner. She has 2 children aged 18 and 23 years. She has worked for more than 5 years selling handicrafts. This loan is the first involvement that she has had with the institution. Rosario will invest this loan in the purchase of a motorcycle, to travel from one location to another carrying her merchandise. Thus she can sell more and generate more income. Rosario is encountering challenges in her business due to the travel that she must undertake to the city of La Paz to buy her products, which she does not make herself but buys already made. She will use this loan to provide a job to her son who helps her a lot in buying her products. Rosario's wish is that as her business grows she can buy her own shop to sell her handicrafts, and thus obtain more income and be able to pay off her house.

loan.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loan.name: Noel Alsides Vallejo

texts.es: El seor Noel se dedica a su negocio de Venta de sandalias, el que se encuentra ubicado en un mercado de la zona sur del Pas hasta donde llegan sus clientes ha comprarle ya que ofrece buen producto y variedad de estilos para nios, jvenes y adultos, desde hace mas de seis aos, esta ubicado en un punto muy estratgico ya que esa zona del mercado es muy visitado todos los das, cuenta con el apoyo de su compaera de hogar con quien tiene 3 hijos y estn estudiando, ella se dedica a una pequea pulpera que tiene en su casa de habitacin. Esta solicitando crdito por valor de L. 25,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de variedad de sandalias ya que la demanda aumenta en esta poca de verano.
texts.en: Noel works in his business selling sandals. He is based in a market in the southern region of the country. His customers travel there to buy his sandals, as he offers a good product and a variety of styles for kids, young people and adults. For more than six years he has been located in this strategic point, as this area of the market has visitors every day. He counts on his wife, with whom he has three school-age children. His wife has a small store that she runs out of a room in their house. Noel is requesting the loan of 25,000 lempira to invest in the purchase of a variety of sandals, since the demand is increasing for this summer season.

loan.use: purchase sandals for his business.

loan.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating her ready to wear clothing business. Customers are attracted to her business due to the low sale prices and the many options offered
Juvy also operates an arcade shop and offers manicure services to earn additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, Juvy is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy ready to wear products and merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Juvy hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loan.use: to purchase for additional stocks of ready-to-wear products.

loan.name: C 20003 Twungubumwe Group

texts.en:
Eliezel is 46 years old and married. He sells rice, which he has been doing for 10 years. The hours of his business are from 6 am to 1 pm five days a week. Eliezel currently employs two people to help him.
Eliezel is a leader of this group which is called "Twungubumwe C20O03." He is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company to expand his agriculture business. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer to cultivate more rice to sell. With the profits, he will be able to save for his future, to pay school fees for his children, and to reinvest in his business.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizer to cultivate rice to sell.

loan.name: Jorge Eudoflio

texts.es: Jorge es un hombre de 51 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar con su heladera movil. Su historia empez hace 12 aos con la venta de un terreno decidi poner una heladera, su trabajo lo hace solo se levanta a las 6:00 y se dirige a su local, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, est casado y su esposa trabaja en casa, tiene2 hijos, su sueo ms importante es comprar cemento arena y piedra para terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos terminen la universidad. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su heladera y asi poder comprar gaseosas, colas y jugos.
texts.en: Jorge is a 51 year old man and he has many aspirations for the coming years. He wants his mobile ice cream business to prosper. His story starts twelve years ago, with the sale of land where he decided to put an ice cream store. He works alone and wakes up at 6:00am to go to his store. He has problems with crime. He is married and his wife works at home. He has two children. His most important dream is to buy cement, sand and rocks to finish building his house and that his children finish college. He wants the loan for his ice cream business and to be able to buy sodas, soft drinks and juices.

loan.use: purchase soft drinks, fizzy drinks and juices.

loan.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
This is Rhodora, 34, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolando who is a driver. She has one child. With her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Rhodora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 11,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.
Rhodora hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To buy groceries and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Sylvie

texts.en: Sylvie is a 42-year-old single mother of 2 children. One child is in high school and the other is in college. She provides and cares for her granddaughter as well. Sylvia has been operating her butcher shop for 1 year. She started selling yogurt in the market and has since expanded to selling meat. She will use the loan to buy fresh meat to stock her shop. She will buy fish, chicken and beef. She has strategically placed her business in an area with no other butcher shops. Her meat products are in high demand. The lack of consistent electricity is a challenge to her business and she hopes to, one day, buy a generator to keep her coolers running. Sylvie has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a very good repayment record. As her business continues to grow, she hopes to open another butcher shop in Brazzaville. She wants her children to continue their education and to be able to attend a university.

loan.use: To pay for fresh meat for her shop.

loan.name: Baptiste

texts.en:
Baptiste is married with six children aged between 5 and 18. They are all enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 6 years. He would like this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to produce more and to pay for his children's school fees. Behind him in the photo are the agriculture borrowers lining up to be photographed by the lending staff.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilisers, seeds and pay for labor

loan.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is married with one child aged three. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 2 years. He would like this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to increase his output.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilisers, seeds and to pay for labor

loan.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes tiene 37 aos, es casada con 4 hijos que tienen las edades de 18,15, 8 y 6 aos, se dedica a la venta de comida que se encuentran en uno de los mercados de la zona sur, este prstamo es la segunda secuencia dentro de la institucin, la Sra. Lourdes utilizara este prstamo para la compra de mercadera como material escolar ya que este es otro emprendimiento que esta tomando la seora segn la temporada ya que empezaron las clases a nivel nacional y quiere aprovechar ya que hay demanda de estos productos, su razn para solicitar este prstamo es falta de recursos. Lourdes enfrenta retos en su negocio que son dar un buen servicio a sus clientes y utilizara los beneficios para aumentar ventas y bienestar de sus hijos, su deseo es ampliar su negocio y ser feliz con sus hijos y esposo.
texts.en: Lourdes is 37 years old, married with four children ages 18, 15, 8 and 6. She sells food in a market in the southern zone. This loan is the second she has taken out from this institution. Lourdes will use the loan to purchase merchandise such as school supplies, which is another entrepreneurial activity that she is taking on, due to the season and that classes have begun nationwide. She wants to take advantage of the demand for these products. Her reason for requesting the loan is that she is lacking resources to make the purchases. Lourdes faces challenges in her business, which are to give good service to her customers and utilize the benefits to increase sales and the well-being of her children. Her wish is to increase her business and to be happy with her children and husband.

loan.use: purchase merchandise, specifically school supplies.

loan.name: Hergenes Ruperto Mendoza Cedeo

texts.es: Ruperto es un hombre de 52 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su taller mecnico su historia empez hace 20 aos primero trabajo para una empresa luego con la liquidacin puso su propio taller, su trabajo lo hace solo se levanta a las 6:00 y abre su taller, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, est casado y su esposa trabaja en casa, tiene3 hijos, su sueo ms importante es terminar de construir su casa ya que empez poniendo las bases y pilares. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su taller mecnico y asi poder comprar soldura, pintura y grasa.
texts.en: Ruperto, 52, has aspirations that in the coming years his mechanics workshop will prosper. His story began 20 years ago with his first company job. Later he was let go and started his own workshop. He works alone, rising at 6:00am to open his workshop. Petty crime can be a problem. He is married and his wife stays at home with their 3 children. His biggest dream is to finish building his house, which he started with foundation and pillars. For that reason he wants a loan for his mechanics shop so that he can buy solder, paint and grease.

loan.use: to buy solder, paint and grease.

loan.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah is 25 years old, married and has one child. She runs a hardware store. She has been in this business for 4 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a fridge, pipes and window panes to sell.

loan.use: To buy a fridge, pipes and window panes to sell.

loan.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 50-year-old married man. He has 4 children aged from 13 to 25. He describes himself as an honest and determined man. He operates a bicycle transportation business. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located at a very competitive area and his primary customers are men. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for business expansion. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy spare parts for his bicycle. Within 5 years, Charles's dream and business goal is to own a pick-up for transporting products for customers.

loan.use: to buy bicycle spare parts.

loan.name: Lorena Angelina

texts.es: Lorena es un mujer de 27 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su comercio su historia empez cuando ella fue madre soltera desde temprana edad y empez su propio negocio para poder mantener a su hija vendiendo ropa, su trabajo lo hace sola desde las 09:00 hasta las 17:00, no tiene dificultades, est en unin libre su conviviente es comerciante de mariscos, si tiene 5 hijos, su sueo ms importante es poner su propio negocio en casa. Por eso quiere el prstamo para la comprar de ropa y cosmeticos y asi obtener mas dinero.
texts.en: Lorena, 27, has hopes that in the coming years her business will prosper. Her story began when she became a single mother at a young age, and she started her business selling clothes in order to take care of her daughter. She works alone from 9:00am until 5:00pm. She says that she doesn't have any challenges. She is in a civil union; her partner is a seafood merchant. They have 5 children. Her biggest dream is to be able to put a store in her home. For that reason she wants a loan to buy clothing and cosmetics so that she can earn more money.

loan.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics.

loan.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, 35 years old, is married and has four children aged between 7 and 13. Emmanuel has five years experience selling general store items and tableware. His hours of work are from 7a.m. until 6p.m.
Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to expand his business by buying more tableware and clothes to sell. Emmanuel would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and be able to pay his children's school fees.

loan.use: To purchase tableware and clothes to sell.

loan.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 30 years old and is married with 2 children. She runs a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 6 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as conducive because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair-dryer and hair chemicals.

loan.use: To buy a hair-dryer and hair chemicals

loan.name: Gaudiose

texts.en:
Gaudiose is married with one child aged three. His wife is a business-woman. He has been a rice farmer for 5 years. He would like this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to increase his output. Behind him in the photo are agriculture borrowers.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilisers and seeds and pay for labor

loan.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 28-year-old married woman who is blessed with one child. She has been operating a retail shop for five years and her primary customers are neighbors. She is blessed with many customers because of her humbleness and friendly attitude. With this blessing, she wants to expand her business by asking for financial assistance from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc.
She is requesting a loan of 25,000 pesos to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and biscuits. She hopes for the improvement of her business. She knows that, with Gods help, she will be able to establish a wholesale business in the future.

loan.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and biscuits

loan.name: Juanita De Dios

texts.es: Juanita es una mujer de 46 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su comercio su historia empez siempre le gusto el comercio y por su hijos decidi buscar clientes, su trabajo lo hace sola todo el da, tiene dificultades son los clientes morosos, no est casada, si tiene 1hijo, su sueo ms importante es comercializar nuevos productos. Por eso quiere el prstamo para la comprar de cremas y perfumes.
texts.en:
Juanita is a 46-year-old woman and has high aspirations for the coming years to make her business successful. Her story began because she always liked the business and because of her children she decided to seek out customers. She works alone all day long. She has some difficulties because of customers who don't pay their bills.
Juanita is not married and has one child. Her biggest dream is to sell new products. For this reason she wants this loan to purchase creams and perfumes.

loan.use: to purchase creams and perfumes.

loan.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is a 58-year-old single woman. She has 2 children aged from 16 to 23. She describes herself as a social woman. She operates a water retail stall. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located at a very competitive slum area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for expanding the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another water outlet. Zainabu's business goal is to have a stable income within 5 years.

loan.use: to buy another water outlet

loan.name: Cruz Maria Cevallos Lopez

texts.es: Mara es una mujer de 44 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su ropa, prendas de vestir y boutique su historia empez as es madre soltera y como el padre de sus hijos no la ayuda ella tomo la decisin de dedicarse al comercio, su trabajo lo hace sola todos los das, no tiene dificultades, est divorciada, tiene 2 hijos, su sueo ms importante es hacer mejoras adecuaciones en su casa. Por eso quiere el prstamo para comprar ropa, prendas de vestir y boutique diversas como perfumes, cosmeticos.
texts.en: Mara is a 44-year-old woman and has great aspirations in the coming years to make her clothing business and boutique successful. Her story began because she is a single mother and her children's father doesn't help her out. That is why she decided to go into sales. She works alone every day and doesn't have any difficulties. She is divorced and has two children. Her biggest dream is to make better improvements to her home. For this reason she wants a loan to purchase clothing and various boutique items such as perfumes and cosmetics.

loan.use: to purchase perfumes and cosmetics.

loan.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives with her husband and 5 children at Besease near Elmina. Her husband is a farmer. Esther sells biscuits, toffees, maize porridge, kenkey and fish. She has been running this business for 12 years. Esther uses her income to assist the husband in paying their childrens school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for her maize porridge, kenkey, biscuits and toffees for sale. With the new profit, Esther will expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase bags of maize, kenkey, biscuits and toffees for sale

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been operating a grocery shop at Besease near Elmiina for 5 years now. She sells items such as milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees and powdered milk. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is a driver. Mary uses her income to support her husband in paying utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase groceries to sell. With the new profit, Mary plans to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loan.name: Ayibe

texts.en: Ayibe is a trader who sells items such as doughnuts, biscuits and powdered soup. She has been doing this for some time now at Besease near Elmina. Ayibe is married to a farmer and has 5 children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their childrens school fees. Ayibe will use her loan to purchase flour for doughnuts, biscuits and powdered soup for sale. With the increased profit, Ayibe wants to buy a grocery shop.

loan.use: to purchase items for sale such as flour, biscuits and powdered soup

loan.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvain is married with six children between the ages of 3 and 18. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for one year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profit, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output, and to put away savings.
In the picture, there are other agriculture borrowers standing behind Sylvain, looking and waiting to get their pictures too.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs.

loan.name: Walaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 22, single and living with six family members, who one of whom works. Walaa has owned a workshop since 2002. He changes oil and sells oils for cars. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers he knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding area.
Walaa is requesting a $2400 loan in order to renovate his shops walls and to add more inventory. He is aiming for more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loan.use: to renovate his shops walls and to add more inventory.

loan.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 48 aos vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chupaca. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades agrcolas es as que cada da est dedicada al cultivo de la papa y maz. Con mucha dedicacin observa los terrenos de cultivo y verifica la aparicin de posibles plagas que pueden afectar seriamente sus cosechas y con ello sus ganancias, de esta manera le permite tomar acciones concretas que la ayudan a tener una buena produccin y recuperacin de la inversin que realiz en la poca de siembra, para ahorrar en su inversin cuenta con sus propios equipos y herramientas como lo son un tractor. Desea para ms adelante aumentar su produccin y comprar ms terrenos agrcolas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario cristo rey y este es el sptimo crdito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Adems le gusta trabajar en su asociacin pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Hilda de recibir su apoyo; invertir el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su campaa de siembra.
texts.en:
Hilda, 48, lives with her husband and three children in her own house, located in the town of Chupaca. Her whole life she has been tied to farming activities. This is how every day she works growing potatoes and corn. With a lot of dedication she looks at the farmland and checks for the appearance of possible pests that can seriously affect her crops as well as her profits. In this way it allows her to take concrete actions that help her have a good production and recover the investment she made in the planting season. To save on her investment, she has her own equipment and tools, such as a tractor. She wants to increase her production and buy more farmland in the future.
She belongs to the Cristo Rey solidarity group, and this is her seventh loan with MFP, where she feels well developed because she gets the help to make progress in her business. For this reason she promises to be punctual with her payments. She also likes to work in her bank because they are responsible and supportive people.
If she receives her support, she will invest the money in buying natural fertilizer for her planting season.

loan.use: to buy bags of natural fertilizer.

loan.name: Roberto Jos

texts.es: Roberto Jos trabaja como locutor en una radio de Managua, est estudiando la carrera de Marketing y Publicidad, y est solicitando el crdito para pagar una especializacin en Direccin de Marketing. Su sueo es poder tener su negocio propio, relacionado con la publicidad y el marketing. Su inspiracin es sacar adelante a su familia a travs de su esfuerzo, le da satisfaccin llegar a ser una profesional
texts.en:
Roberto Jos works as a radio announcer in Managua. He is studying the career of Marketing and Publicity. He is requesting the loan to pay for a specialization in Marketing Management.
His dream is to be able to have his own publicity and marketing business. His motivation is to get his family ahead through his effort. It gratifies him to come to be a professional.

loan.use: to pay for specialization.

loan.name: Sofia Maricela

texts.es: Sofa es estudiante de la carrera de Relaciones Internacionales, est solicitando el crdito para pagar el curso de titulacin y graduacin de su carrera. Su mayor sueo en la vida es graduarse, trabajar y darle una buena educacin a su hija. Se sentir realizada como profesional y como madre de familia. Le gusta comunicarse con las personas, y conocer las relaciones que tiene su pas con el mundo entero.
texts.en: Sofa is studying International Affairs and is asking for a loan to pay fees for her career's professional title and graduation. Her greatest dream in life is to graduate, work and provide her daughter with a good education. She will feel fulfilled as a professional and as a mother. She likes communicating with people and to know the relationships her country has with the entire world.

loan.use: to pay fees for her professional title and graduation.

loan.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 19-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings, one of whom is working. His father is the main income provider in the family and looking to better support them. Ali started to work as a blacksmith in 2009. So far, he has a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, hes requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added metal and supplies for his business. This will speed up his work and allow him to serve a wider range of people. In the future, he plans to join a local company in his free time and benefit from their experience.

loan.use: to purchase metal and supplies for his business

loan.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two working siblings. His parents work really hard to cover all their costs and fulfill their needs. As for Ahmad, he has owned a carpentry shop since 2009 and has already got eight years of experience in this domain. He knows well how to deal with his customers and tries his best to please them. Today, he is asking for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase an electrical generator for his business. He says that this will facilitate his work and allow him to complete his work as it should be. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects from outside the country.

loan.use: to purchase an electrical generator for his business

loan.name: Kaiss

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, single and has six children.
Kaiss has been an owner of a shop since 1998, selling spare parts for cars. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.
He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his familys life as a whole.

loan.use: to pay the annual rent.

loan.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 19-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and three siblings. His father works hard to enhance his family and childrens way of living. In order to help his father, Samir started his own business as an event organizer two years ago. He attends weddings, parties and any kind of events upon customers requests.
Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new sound system equipment. This loan will improve his work and allow him to attend more and bigger events. In the future, he plans to open his own events-organizing company.

loan.use: to purchase new sound system equipment.

loan.name: Ervin Domingo

texts.es: El trabajo de operador de Bomba requiere de mucha responsabilidad. Consciente de esto, El seor Ervin se dedica a laborar de esa manera en el municipio de Telica con 6 aos de ejrcelo de manera continua, dentro su ncleo familiar tiene a su cargo una hija en estudios secundarios y otra que es la graduando, para seguir apoyando a su hija como sueo de padre para con sus hijos profesionalizarlos en el futuro, por eso. El acude a Ceprodel porque requiere solicitar un crdito para los gastos de titulacin, Esto con el fin de iniciar el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida que tanto lo requiere para beneficio propio y familiar y de esa manera darle las condiciones que tanto anhela como un buen padre de familia que quiere y piensa en lo mejor para ellos.
texts.en:
The work of a pump operator requires a lot of responsibility. Ervin is aware of this fact and has been working continually in this job, in the town of Telica, for six years. Within his nuclear family, Ervin is responsible for one daughter who is in high school and another who is graduating. Ervin wants to continue supporting his daughters because his dream as a father is for his children to become professionals in the future.
Ervin came to Ceprodel because he needed to request a loan to cover his daughter's graduation expenses with the aim of starting to improve her standard of living as well as that of the family. This will enable him to provide her with the conditions that he longs to as a good father who loves his children and wants the best for them.

loan.use: to cover education expenses, paying graduation costs

loan.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is 25 years old and single. She lives with her parents. Her father is the main source of income in the family and she is trying her best to contribute to covering their family expenses.
Zahra started selling cosmetics products in 2010 on a freelance basis and has customers from all over the neighbor. She is requesting a youth loan from Ameen s.a.l., which she will use to buy additional cosmetic products helping her attract more customers and increase her profits. In the future, Zahra plans to open her own cosmetics shop.

loan.use: to purchase cosmetic products.

loan.name: Mansurzhon

texts.en: Mansurzhon is a hard-working and intelligent person. He is married and bringing up four children. He has been working as a farmer for over 15 years. He mainly grows grains, melons and watermelons. His wife helps him in his business. Mansurzhon is requesting a loan to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants. He plans to use the rest of the money for transportation expenses. He is hoping for your help and compassion.

loan.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loan.name: Sajeda

texts.en:
Sajeda is a 24-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.
Sajeda is a tailor and she is working from her home and requesting a youth loan of 1000 JD to purchase raw materials needed (fabrics, thread, etc.)
Sajeda is looking to expand her business and increase her income.

loan.use: to purchase raw materials needed (fabrics, thread, etc.)

loan.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin aged 51 is a business-oriented woman. She manages a small store selling grocery items to the village. This is her fruitful business that provides a small improvement to their daily living. With the spur to achieve a better quality of life, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional funding to purchase extra groceries to stock in her store.
Someday, she hopes that she would be able to experience a comfortable life with a lesser burden in her daily routine. But for now, Melvin is required to work hard and accept all the challenges she encounters.

loan.use: to purchase extra groceries to stock in her store

loan.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.
Suhair is a 28-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.
Suhair has a home-based project in which she sells clothes to neighbors and friends. She is requesting a youth loan of 600 JD to purchase more clothes for business purposes.
Suhair is looking to open a shop for her business so that she can increase her income and expand her customer base.

loan.use: to purchase more clothes for business purposes

loan.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband, Firas.
Huda is a 27-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan.
Huda is a tailor. She has a small workshop and is requesting a youth loan of 1000 JD to purchase a sewing machine for it.
Huda is looking to exband her business and increase her income.

loan.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her workshop

loan.name: Qamar

texts.en:
Qamar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Her husband, Mashhour, appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is shown next to the vehicle he purchased.
Qamar is a 23-year-old woman. She is the mother of two daughters. Her husband is a vehicle electrician who has training in vehicle electrical systems.
Qamar is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband complete the price of purchasing a new vehicle for the family's use. This will help the family go from one place to another and provide a better standard of living.

loan.use: To complete the price for purchasing a vehicle

loan.name: Raja'

texts.en:
Raja' is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Ayham appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is photographed at the location of their new house.
Raja' is a 22-year-old young woman. She is married to Ayham and they have no children yet. She is employed and her husband is a construction worker, both are getting low salaries which are not enough to cover their daily costs.
Raja' is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the expenses of finishing their new house, such as installing windows, tiles, sinks and electric extensions. This loan will enable Raja' and her husband to complete finishing their house and move into it and live in it soon. This will improve the house's condition and offer Raja' and her husband better living conditions.

loan.use: finish building her house

loan.name: Yousef J'aidi

texts.en:
Yousef is a 26-year-old single young man. He is a worker in a local hospital. He earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover his daily needs and costs.
Yousef is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer to Yousef comfortable furniture so he can enjoy living in his house.
Yousef is photographed in his house.

loan.use: to purchase living room furniture.

loan.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 21-year-old single man. He works with his family in agriculture. The income the family earns from working in agriculture is low and not enough to cover the family's needs and medical expenses.
Fadi's father is suffering from a disease and needs urgent surgery, so Fadi wants to help his father pay the medical expenses.
Fadi is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help his father cover the medical expenses. This will improve Fadi's father's health and enable him to live in normal conditions with the family. Fadi is photographed in the picture.

loan.use: To pay the medical expenses to cure his father

loan.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
This is Cleofe, 49, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, her business partner, and is a mother to their two children who are both working. While attending to her family needs, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining daily expenses.
Cleofe owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She is also into food vending and piggery businesses. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 Philippine Pesos in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loans. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items and enable her to have more stock. The more items displayed at the store the better, as it helps to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in better profit. It will help her to save more money for any possible expenditures ahead.
Cleofe hopes that her business will continue to grow. She hopes that she will be able to buy her own lot and have a better place for her business. She wishes that her family will continue to enjoy good health. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* meetings as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. Sharing the word of God strengthens her faith.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Afellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single young man. His father is a school teacher and his mother is employed in a clothing store. Both are getting low salaries, which are not enough to cover the family's costs.
For the past two years, Ahmad has had a sewing workshop for sewing clothes for customers, which has been a profitable project.
Ahmad is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing an additional sewing machine to provide better quality to his loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income.
Ahmad is photographed in his workshop.

loan.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine

loan.name: Javier Alberto

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 49 aos de edad que se dedica a realizar el servicio de corte y tallado artesanal de madera, esta actividad le permite generar los ingresos necesarios para su familia, pero tambin trabaja como obrero en algunas ocasiones lo que le permite generar un ingreso extra, a su vez su esposa lo apoyo con los gastos de la casa, actualmente su esposa se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y tiene buena acogida de clientes debido a que es un plato muy popular entre los peruanos.
Javier trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias, en donde atiene a 5 clientes en la semana, el se est haciendo conocido por las recomendaciones de sus clientes, en vista a que hace un buen trabajo, pero lamentablemente ahora tiene dificultades con su moto sierra es por esto que desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarlo y as realizarle el mantenimiento que su moto sierra necesita y tambin comprar sillas y mesas para el negocio de salchipapas de su esposa. l est muy contento por la ayuda brindada y la confianza que se le ha dado.
Javier y su esposa estn dispuestos a hacer muchas cosas que su pequeo se convierta en todo un profesional y salir adelante como familia.
texts.en:
Javier is a 49 year old men that cuts and carves wood, this activity allows him to generate the necessary income for his family, he is also a casual worker to generate extra income, his wife also helps with the house expenses, she currently sells salchipapas (french fries with wieners) and has a good number of clients because this is a popular food item amongst Peruvians.
Javier works approximately 8 hours a day, where he looks after 5 clients per week, he is getting word of mouth from his client's recommendations, because he does a good job, unfortunately he now has problems with the chain saw and hopes that Kiva borrowers can help him so he can give it maintenance and also to buy tables and chairs for the salchipapas business his wife has. He is very happy for the help provided and the trust they've given him.
Javier and his wife are willing to do lots for their little one to become a professional and to get ahead as a family.

loan.use: to pay for maintenance of his chain saw and to buy tables and chairs for his wife's business

loan.name: Wilfredo Rene

texts.es: El seor Wilfredo tiene 47 aos es cliente antiguo de emprender, y tambin sac varios crditos "kiva", debido a su actividad que es la reparacin de vehculos el saca montos relativamente pequeos, en esta ocasin solicita para compra de lubricantes para su taller, pero en el transcurso de estos aos se compro un terreno en el que construye su vivienda que sigue todava en construccin, es casado y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, el trabaja junto a su esposa, quien tambin se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y apoya a su esposo, seor Wilfredo es cliente responsable haciendo buen uso de los crditos solicitados, es muy trabajador y agradecido con la institucin por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Wilfredo is an old client of Emprender, and has also had several loans through Kiva. Because his business is auto repair, he requests relatively small amounts. On this occasion he requests a loan to buy lubricants for his shop, however, over the past few years, he purchased land where he is building his house, he is married and has three children that are students, he works along with his wife, who also sells lubricants and supports her husband in his endeavors. Wilfredo is a responsible client who has made good use of the requested credits. He is very hard working, and thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loan.use: to buy lubricants.

loan.name: Dania Lissette

texts.es: La seora Dania, Administradora de una empresa de nuestra ciudad de Nicaragua; manifiesta que mediante el apoyo encontrado en Afodenic y kiva a podido ver realizado sus sueos. En esta ocasin el destino que tendra su prestamo sera para realizar las compras de los siguientes materiales de construccion: bloques, hierro, cemento, piedrin, estribos entre otros y de esta forma llevar a cabo la construccion de su muro de al fondo de su propiedad, esto es con el fin de alcanzar mayor seguridad para su vivienda y sus familiares.
texts.en: Dania is an administrator at a business in our city of Nicaragua. She explains that through the support she has found in Afodenic and Kiva, she has been able to achieve her dreams. On this occasion, her loan will be destined to buying the following construction materials: cement blocks, rebar, cement, gravel, and rebar hoops, among other items. This way she will be able to build a wall at the back of her property. This is so that she can achieve greater security for her home and her family.

loan.use: to by construction materials for a wall at her house.

loan.name: Nassim

texts.en: Nassim is a 37-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 to 14 years old. She describes herself to be a loving and jovial woman. She operates a poultry business where she sells chicks. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuations of prices of chicken feed. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more chicks. Nassim's business goal is to have many broilers (type of chicken) within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build rental houses.

loan.use: to purchase more chicks.

loan.name: Eleros

texts.en:
Eleros is 34 years old and engaged in vegetable vending. She has been doing this for more than a year. She is very industrious in selling every day in the village. Her eagerness to improve their living situation inspires her to work daily.
Right now, she is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy additional vegetables to offer such as pechay and squash. She hardily believes that with strong determination and hard work, she will reap success someday.

loan.use: to buy additional vegetables such as pechay and squash to sell

loan.name: Paulin

texts.en:
Paulin is married with 10 children between 3 and 17 years old. All of the children are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for two years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output to build a nice house.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor costs.

loan.name: Pain De Vie Plus Group

texts.en:
Pain de Vie Plus is a Community Bank of 22 owners of small businesses who selected Mado as chairwoman. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRCongo to grow their businesses. They organized themselves by affinity and proximity.
Mado earns a living by selling loaves of bread in her neighborhood located northeast of Kinshasa. She has more customers. She started her business with a beginning capital of US $40. Today, her business brings in a profit of US $40 each week. Mado is planning with the next loan to increase the stock of business by buying more loaves of bread to resell at profit. Her ambition is to provide loaves of bread to more than 1,000 customers in medium term. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of four children between the ages of 6 and 16. Four of them go to school.

loan.use: to buy more loaves of bread to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Sansie's Group

texts.en: These are teachers of a primary school in Koidu city. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of SLL 3,800,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve their standard of living. Thirty-five-year-old Sansie is the leader of this group of teachers. Sansie was born in a place called Nongowa. He is married and has two children, one in secondary school and the other is in college. Sansie is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for nine years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school/college fees for his children. School staff from this institution, like many other school's staff within SMTs operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise have not been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institutions bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loan.use: to pay school/college fees for his children

loan.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells slippers and rice at Besease near Elmina. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Esi is married and has one child. Esis husband is an electrician. Esi uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. Esi will use her loan to purchase more slippers and bags of rice to sell. With the new profit, Esi wishes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more slippers and bags of rice to sell

loan.name: Nyame

texts.en: Nyame is a widow. She is a cone mill operator. In addition, she sells kako, pepper and saucepans at Besease near Elmina. She has been in this business for the past 30 years now. She has five dependants. Nyame is responsible for the upkeep of her children. Nyame will use her loan to purchase more kako, pepper and saucepans to sell. Nyame plans to expand her business with her new profit.

loan.use: to purchase more kako (salted fish), pepper and saucepans to sell

loan.name: Lagbeh

texts.en: Lagbeh is 32 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has two children, both of whom are presently in school. For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loan.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loan.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a petty trader who sells salted fish, onions, palm oil, salt and other food items at Besease near Elmina. Efua is married to a farmer and has five children. She has been in this business for some years now. Efua uses her income to help her husband in the upkeep of their children. She will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to salt and then sell. Efua will expand her business with her new profit

loan.use: to purchase more fresh fish to salt

loan.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells doughnuts and cooks banku and stew to sell at Besease near Elmina. She is a single parent and has four children. Abena has been doing this for eight years. She is responsible for the upkeep of her children. She will use her loan to buy flour and sugar for the doughnuts and maize for the preparation of her banku. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy flour, sugar and maize

loan.name: Norah

texts.es: La Sra. Norah tiene 37 aos y es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos que son 6 aos y 14 aos ambos se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de comida que se encuentran en la zona del Guaracal, este prstamo es la segunda secuencia dentro de la institucin, Norah utilizara este prstamo para Capital de Trabajo ( Compra de 1 parrilla grade y capital de inversin) para su negocio, la razn para solicitar este prstamo es hacer crecer su negocio ya que quiere elaborar parrillada para vender los fines de semana, la Sra. Norah enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y utilizara los beneficios del crdito en incrementar su capital de trabajo, el deseo de la Sra. Norah es comprar un lote de terreno, para despus ir construyendo su casita propia, la Sra. Norah se siente feliz y agradecida con la institucin por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Norah, 37, is a single mother with two school-aged children who are 6 and 14. She sells food for a living in the area of Guaracal. This is her second loan from the institution and she plans to use it as working capital (to buy a large grill and to have investment capital) for her business. Her reason for requesting the loan is to expand her business since she wants to sell grilled food on weekends. Norah has challenges in her business such as competition, and she plans to use the profits from the loan to increase her work capital. Norah's goal is to buy land to build her own house. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support shown her.

loan.use: To buy a large grill and to have investment capital.

loan.name: Francisco Eloy Tomala Rivera

texts.es: Francisco es un hombre de 52 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su tienda y bazar. Su historia empez con el fin de cubrir la necesidad de su barrio y al mismo tiempo lucrarse por medio de un negocio, su trabajo lo realiza solo todo el da, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, est soltero, tiene 1 hijo, su sueo ms importante es comprarse un carro y trabajarlo. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su tienda-bazar y asi comprar granos, enlatados, bebidas.
texts.en: Francisco, 52, is very determined to see his general store prosper over the coming years. His story began when he saw both a need in his neighborhood and a way to earn a living. He works alone all day and runs into problems with delinquency. He is single and has a son, and has as his main goal being able to buy a car for work. He is requesting a loan to buy grains, canned goods and beverages for his store.

loan.use: To buy grains, canned goods and beverages.

loan.name: Nydia Ivonne

texts.es: Nydia es una mujer de 25 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su venta de mercadera. Su historia empez cuando tena la necesidad de trabajar porque quieren construir su casa ya que era de madera, su trabajo lo hace sola todas las tardes, no tiene dificultades, est unida, tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es tener su casa. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su venta de mercadera y asi comprar telas, ropa y textiles.
texts.en: Nydia, 25, is determined to see her merchandise sales business prosper over the next few years. Her story began out of necessity because she wanted to earn money to build a house. She works every afternoon by herself and does not have any difficulties. She is married and has children, and her main goal in life is to have her own house. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, clothing and textiles to sell.

loan.use: To buy fabric, clothing and textiles.

loan.name: Katheryn Dennis

texts.es: Katheryn es una mujer de 21 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su venta de producto por catalogo su historia empez prestando cdigos hasta obtener un capital y ahora cuenta con nuevos productos, su trabajo lo hace sola todas las tardes, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no est casada, no tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es tener un local bien surtido con mas productos y casarme y tener familia. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su venta de producto por catalogo y asi comprar perfumes, cremas, desodorantes.
texts.en: Katheryn, 21, is very determined to see her catalogue sales business prosper over the next few years. Her story began when she earned enough capital to buy new products to sell. She works by herself every afternoon and does run into some problems with delinquency. She is single and has no children and her main goal is to open a well-stocked shop and marry one day and have a family. She is requesting a loan to buy catalogue products such as perfumes, creams and deodorants.

loan.use: To buy perfumes, creams and deodorants.

loan.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora es una mujer de 61 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su venta de liquido como detergentes y tambien da servicio de niera para tener mas ingresos. su historia empez porque era una persona mayor y decidi ponerse un local en su domicilio, su trabajo lo hace sola todas las tardes, no tiene dificultades, no est casada, tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es tener estabilizado su negocio. Por eso quiere el prstamo para mejorar domicilio ya que quiere tener un lugar donde poner los liquidos que vende.
texts.en: Dora, 61, is determined to get ahead over the next few years in her business selling liquids such as detergents, and also working as a babysitter for extra income. Her story began when she decided to set up a sales point in her home, because of her advanced age. She works alone every afternoon and does not have difficulties. She is not married but has children. Her main goal is to stabilize her business, so she wants to use the loan to improve her home since it is where she stores the liquids she sells.

loan.use: To buy cement, sand and blocks.

loan.name: Tulkin

texts.en: Tulkin is a hardworking and dedicated man. He is married and the responsible father of five children. He has been buying and selling livestock for more than 20 years. He is also involved in agriculture. He uses agricultural waste to feed his livestock. His wife helps him with the business. Tulkin is requesting a loan to purchase one head of cattle and two head of small livestock. With the remaining money, he wants to buy wheat and barley seeds. He looks forward to your help and kindness.

loan.use: to buy cattle and seeds.

loan.name: Angela Gregoria

texts.es: ngela es una mujer de 35 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar en su servicios de limpieza de ropa. Su historia empez cuando inicio prestado su servicio de limpieza a sus amigas de ay en adelante poco a poco continuo prestando sus servicios, lavando ropa. Su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, no est casada, tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es formar su propia empresa de limpieza. Por eso quiere el prstamo para mejorar sus servicios de limpieza de ropa comprando una lavadora y detergentes.
texts.en: ngela is a 35 year old woman and she hopes to do well in her job of washing clothes in the coming years. Her story began when she started providing a cleaning service for her friends and from there she gradually continued offering her services by washing clothes. She works alone and has no difficulties. She isnt married and she has children. Her most important dream is to start up her own cleaning company. Therefore she wants the loan to improve her laundry service, by purchasing a washing machine and detergent.

loan.use: to buy detergent and a washing machine

loan.name: Shirle Piedad Romero Espinoza

texts.es: Shirle es una mujer de 40 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su taller estilista. Su historia empez cuando cogi esta actividad de belleza y maquillaje. Le gustaba el estudio en casos de bellezas por eso en la actualidad su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, est casada, tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es terminar su vivienda. Por eso quiere el prstamo para mejorar su local del salon de belleza comprando cemento, arena, pinturas.
texts.en: Shirle is a 40-year old woman, and she has great aspirations in the next few years to make her beauty salon a success. Her history began when she started in this business of beauty and makeup. She liked the study of beauty, and she carries out her current work alone. She has some difficulties, which are delinquencies. She is married, has children, and her most important dream is finishing her home. For this reason, she would like the loan in order to improve her beauty salon site, purchasing cement, sand, and paints.

loan.use: to buy cement, sand and paints.

loan.name: Herminia Yenny Fajardo Sanchez

texts.es: Herminia es una mujer de 46 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su venta de cosmticos su historia empez vendiendo zapatillas y cosmticos a las amigas del novio me gusta el comercio, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no est casada, tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es tener mi propio local y algunos empleados para dar trabajo a mis personas. Por eso quiere el prstamo para comprar perfumes, cremas, materia prima para zapatillas y asi mejorar su ingresos.
texts.en: Herminia is a 46-year old woman, and she has great aspirations in the next few years to make her cosmetics sales business a success. Her history began when she started selling slippers and cosmetics to the friends of her boyfriend. She enjoys commerce, and she carries out her current work alone. She has some difficulties, which are delinquencies. She is single, has children, and her most important dream is having her own locale and some employees in order to provide work for her people. For this reason, she would like the loan in order to buy perfumes, creams, and raw materials for slippers so she can improve her income.

loan.use: to acquire perfumes, creams, and raw materials for slippers.

loan.name: Orlando Teodulfo Rivera

texts.es: Orlando es un hombre de 35 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su panadera su historia empez cuando aprendi pastelera y panadera y decido incursionar en el negocio, el trabajo lo hace con su esposa, no tiene dificultades, est casado, tiene hijos, su sueo ms importante es seguir estable con su negocio. Por eso quiere el prstamo para su panadera y asi comprar azucar, harina, bebidas etc.
texts.en: Orlando is a 35-year old man, and he has great aspirations in the next few years to make his bakery business a success. His history began when he learned cake and bread making, and he decided to start a business. He carries out his work with his wife. He doesnt have any difficulties, is married, has children, and his most important dream is to continue forward with a stable business. For this reason, he would like a loan for his bakery in order to buy sugar, flour, beverages, etc.

loan.use: to buy supplies for his locale such as sugar, flour, beverages, etc.

loan.name: Ana Maria Natividad

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 42 aos de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los prximos aos de prosperar su venta de comida.
