Her strategy for growing her business is to find markets for her tomatoes. In the coming years, she would like to be the distributor of tomatoes in her region. With the profits she makes she plans to educate and look after her children, as well as to build a house to live in.

loan.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loan.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin Antonio originario del sauce, esta casado, es un hombre trabajador al igual que su esposa son personas luchadoras, que tienen como fin mejorar cada da su casa, para brindarles un hogar digno a sus hijos as como llevarles el pan de cada da.
Se dedica a impartir clases como maestro de primaria, en una escuela de un comunidad muy cercana al municipio, donde tiene muchos aos experiencia en esta profesin que le genera sus propios ingresos, con el que mantiene su hogar, y que le satisface desempearlo, se siente feliz de ayudar a estos nios ensendoles a leer y a escribir, sobre todo en el campo, que son de escasos recursos.
En estos momentos tiene la necesidad de mejorar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita su tercer crdito en Ceprodel, para la compra de ladrillos, hierro, cemento y pago de mano de obra, lo que espera que dicha Institucin le brinde su mano y apoye para cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Marvin Antonio comes from El Sauce and is married. He is hard-working and determined, just like his wife. Their aim is to keep making improvements to their house, so that they can provide their children with a decent home as well as putting food on the table for them.
Marvin Antonio is a primary school teacher; he teaches classes at a school in a neighbourhood close to the town. He has many years of experience in this profession. It enables him to earn his own money, which he uses to look after his home. He enjoys his job and gains a sense of satisfaction from helping children by teaching them to read and write, especially in the countryside, where money is scarce.
Marvin Antonio currently needs some maintenance work done to the roof of his house, which is why he is requesting his third loan from Ceprodel. He intends to use the money to buy bricks, iron and cement and to pay the workers. He hopes that the aforementioned institution will provide him with help and support so that he can fulfil this aim.

loan.use: to buy bricks, iron and cement and to pay a team of construction workers.

loan.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: En el municipio de Telica departamento de len, originario de una comarca aledaa El seor Julio es Felizmente Casado, de profesin Productor Agropecuario ejerce las dos actividades es un seor emprendedor, con 1hijo a su cargo, al que tiene el deber de mantener sus estudios, ya que trabaja en conjunto en los tiempos libres dedicndose apoyar en las diferentes actividades , tiene 46 aos de ejercerlas Desde que inicio su negocio El seor Julio lo que es la Agricultura en pequeas areas se esforz por mejorar y emprender otra actividad como es la Crianza de Ganado tanto de leche como para el trabajo agrcola, siendo las ambas de gran fortaleza econmica tradicional desde sus padres y de esa manera mantener su familia la que es independiente por su propia cuenta y hoy vivir la vejez de manera satisfactoria y realizada con sus hijos formados con sus familias propias, una de la necesidad es la compra de un novillo para trabajo
texts.en:
Julio lives in the municipality of Telica, in the state of Len. He is originally from a rural area. Julio is happily married and his profession is agriculture and raising animals. He is entrepreneurial. He supports one son by helping pay for his education. His son works with him when he has time off, helping with various activities. Julio has done this type of work for 46 years.
Ever since Julio started small-scale farming, he has made efforts to improve and add other activities such as raising cattle for milk and for agricultural work. Both activities have traditionally been economically strong since his parents' time. In this way he has been able to support his family, who now live independently. Now he can live out his old age content and fulfilled, having raised his children, who now have their own families.
He needs to purchase a young steer for work.

loan.use: to purchase a young steer.

loan.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es: En el municipio de Larreynaga Malpaisillo en un poblado del departamento de len, la seora Juana se dedica arduamente a laborar como Auxiliar de enfermera, actualmente esta desempendose con el cargo antes mencionado, dedicndose a esta labor desde hace 35 aos, es Viuda con 1 hija y 2 nietos a su cargo al que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle, responsabilidad que asumi de una hija de ella. Una de las necesidades que la seora Juana atraviesa es de Mejorar su vivienda, como es la construccin de la cocina y piso, la que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le permiti tomar la decisin de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crdito para la compra de Materiales de construccin como: Zinc, Cemento, arena, Pilares, Alfajillas, Ventanas y Mano de Obra, mejorando su vida.
texts.en: In the city of Larreynaga Malpaisillo in a region of the department of Len, Mrs. Juana works hard as a nurse's aid. Currently she is working in this area, and has dedicated herself to this labor for the past 35 years. She is a widow with one daughter, and she has two grandchildren in her care for whom she has to provide the necessary conditions for their development. She took on this responsibility from her daughter. One of Mrs. Juana's needs is to improve her home, including the construction of a kitchen and a floor. They currently are in poor condition. For that reason, she decided to visit Ceprodel, Kiva's field partner, in order to ask for credit for the purchase of construction materials like zinc, cement, sand, pillars, metal plates, windows, and manual labor. This will improve her quality of life.

loan.use: to purchase construction materials like zinc, cement, sand, pillars, metal plates, windows, and manual labor.

loan.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is 41 years old. She lives in Ijevan with her family. Armenuhis husband doesnt work as he is disabled person. Armenuhi has two sons who are students at a European college. They both are students in accounting and auditing. Her elder son is a third-year student, and her younger son is a first-year student.
Armenuhi has to work hard at three different companies as an accountant to provide for her family and to pay for her childrens education. Armenuhi is sure that after graduation her sons will find a job and help her to support their family.
Armenuhi is seeking a 200,000 AMD loan to pay for her two sons education in their next semester in college.

loan.use: to pay for her two sons education.

loan.name: Asatur

texts.en:
Asatur is 41 years old and he lives in Yerevan with his family, which consists of his wife and two school-aged children.
Asatur has a secondary education. Because he couldnt find a job in Armenia, he and his family moved to Russia where they ran a food trading business. But then they decided to return to their native land and organize their own business in Armenia.
So Asatur and his wife have been running a shoe selling business for about 5 years. They rent a stall where they sell mens and womens shoes.
Once a month Asatur goes to a neighboring country and buys merchandise for his business. He also buys shoes from Yerevan wholesale markets.
Asatur says that the most saleable goods are sports shoes and womens high-heeled boots, so he tries to put an emphasis on those goods. Thanks to the family business, Asatur and his wife can provide for their family.
This is Asaturs fifth loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments. Now he needs a $2,000 loan to buy spring season shoes to resell.

loan.use: to buy spring season shoes to resell.

loan.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is 54 years old. She lives in Vanadzor with her husband and a son. Rima works at a clothing factory as a seamstress, and her husband works for the railway company as a watchman. Thanks to their salaries, Rima and her husband support their family.
Rimas son is a second-year student at the Vanadzor branch of the European Regional Educational Academy. He studies in the Economics and Management Department. Rima is asking for a 130,000 AMD loan to pay for her sons education.

loan.use: to pay for her sons education.

loan.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa is 31 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (or Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, her oldest child is a school and her younger two children are in kindergarten. She started her garment-retailing business in 2002. Over the years since, she has gained many regular customers because her garments are inexpensive but elegant. The Mongolian holiday season is approaching, and demand for her products is increasing. Therefore, she is requesting a loan for 2,500,000 MNT to increase her stock so that she can meet this demand. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I have a mission to get my children educated."

loan.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loan.name: Nancy Sianoi

texts.en: Nancy is a farmer and has been in this line of work for the past 10 years. She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her prepare her land and buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides. She hopes to boost her farming business and get a good crop.

loan.use: to prepare her land by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticides

loan.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr: DANAYA est un regroupement de 4 femmes ayant en moyenne trente cinq ans, quatre enfants et vivant dans des familles nuclaires TIELE, une des communes de la sous prfecture de BAGUINEDA (2me rgion administrative du Mali). Elles sont leur cinquime collaboration avec linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce du riz, de viande et de la restauration avec KADIA qui est la prsidente du groupe et la deuxime droite sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prt, 3 sacs du riz et une grande quantit de condiments. Elle sapprovisionne au grand march de TIELE et marchs environnants auprs des grossistes. Elle prpare et effectue sa vente sur place au march et domicile une clientle compose essentiellement de femmes, en dtail, au comptant et crdit. Elle envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilise pour lappui de son mari dans les dpenses quotidiennes et lautre partie sera investie dans les activits.
texts.en: DANAYA is a grouping of four women who on average are 35 years old, have four children, and live in nuclear families in Tiele, one of the communes in the subprefecture of Baguineda (2nd administrative region of Mali). They are on their fifth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. This group of women do business in rice, meat and food service with Kadia, who is the present of the group and second from the right in the photo. She count on buying three bags of rice and a big bag of spices with the loan. She stocks up from wholesalers in the big market in Tiele and in markets around the area. She prepares and sells in the market and at home, doing retail sales to a customer base composed mostly of women, for cash and on credit. She imagines making a monthly profit of 25,000 francs, of which one part would be used to support her husband in everyday expenses and the other part would be invested in her business.

loan.use: Pour acheter dingrdients pour la restauration

loan.name: Enhbayar

texts.en: Enhbayar is a widowed woman who lives with her 5 children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. Since her husband died 8 years ago, she has been responsible for the children's future. She started a retail business in 2006. She has been selling different kinds of things, including clothes, household goods, and kitchen utensils at the shop counter. Now she wants to bring in these types of goods in large quantities from the capital city and wants to purchase them before Tsagaan Sar, a national holiday, so that she can increase the family's income and pay for college and other related expenses. The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to purchase children sock, glass dish and khadag, a specially made band of silk for tsagaan sar.

loan.use: To purchase children sock, glass dish and khadag

loan.name: Ayuen

texts.en: Ayuen lives in the town of Bor. She earns a living by selling food from a stall, and has been in this business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. Ayuen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and is requesting her second loan from our organization, for SDG 800, to buy beans and rice. She will use the extra income she earns from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: to buy beans and rice to sell.

loan.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 30 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (or Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband is a car driver and her son is a kindergarten student. She started her grocery-selling business in 2010 by renting a small shop. Her location is good and her business is stable. Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, she needs to buy more grocery products to meet customer demand. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy these groceries. In the future, she would like to have her own grocery store.

loan.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes has been a poultry farmer in Nakuru town for the last 15 years. In addition to poultry farming, her primary activity, she also has a retail shop. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of one child. She was introduced to KADET LTD. during a marketing and awareness effort in Nakuru. She plans to use this loan to buy more chicks to rear for sale. This will allow her to meet the demand from her clients and hence increase her income. In the future, Agnes hopes to grow her business and distribute poultry and eggs to different hotels and markets in Nakuru.

loan.use: to buy more chicks to rear for sale.

loan.name: Alimardon

texts.en: Alimardon is married and raising two children. He has been involved in buying and selling livestock and also growing agricultural crops for over two years. He is the owner of this business and started it with with five heads of small livestock. Currently, he has one head of cattle and ten heads of small livestock. He wants to improve his living conditions and tries to expand his business with this goal in mind. Alimardon is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 Somoni to buy one head of cattle, mineral fertilizers and fuel. He relies on your help and kindness.

loan.use: to buy cattle, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loan.name: Gafurjon

texts.en: Gafurjon is married and raising five children. He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 20 years. He is also involved in growing agricultural crops. The leftovers from growing go toward feeding the livestock. Gafurjon wants to make a good profit in order to repair his house. Gafurjon wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to buy two heads of cattle. He relies on your help and mercy.

loan.use: to buy cattle

loan.name: Master

texts.en:
Master is 44 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in Bayan-Ulgii province in Western Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and his daughter studies at the local secondary school. Master started a food market business in 2008 with his money. The market is well-positioned and has many regular customers in the area. He is improving the family livelihood with the business income.
In the last 2 years, he has been retailing livestock. To expand the business and get the needs for the wife and daughter, Master needs a specific amount of financial support. Master is a wise man who says that "I would like to expand my business and improve the livelihood so that I could save for my daughter's future. The way to expand the business is to get the supplies in large quantities". The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to purchase livestock from herders.

loan.use: To purchase livestock from herders

loan.name: Mandah

texts.en:
Mandah is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business; his elder kid is a college student; and the younger one is a school student.
He started his second-hand garment trading business in 2004 by renting a counter in a market. He sterilizes his garments by himself. Over the years, he has gained many regular customers. Now that he is experienced in his field, he expanded his business by renting another counter in a market.
He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "Now that my daughter is in college, I have to do everything I can in order to support his." He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy additional supplies.

loan.use: To buy additional supplies.

loan.name: Taiba

texts.en: Taibahon is married and a loving mother of three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Taibahon has been involved in buying and selling cotton fabrics at a store for over 12 years. She buys her merchandise 3-4 times per month. Her husband helps her with the business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 12000 Somoni to improve her living conditions and finish building her house. Taibahon relies on your help and kindness.

loan.use: to repair her house

loan.name: Chogjmoo

texts.en: Chogjmoo is 52 years old and lives with her husband and 2 kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband is a cab driver. The elder kid is employed and younger one is a college student. She started her meat retailing business in 1993 by renting a counter. She has gained many customers and trusted suppliers over the years. Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, her product demand is high. Therefore she's requesting 1,300,000 MNT to buy livestock. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "My son joined a college. Therefore, I need to work as hard as I can in order to support him."

loan.use: To purchase livestock

loan.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 48 years old. She is from Nakuru, and she has a driving school business. She is married and has two children who are 14 and 21 years old.
Jennifer is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy a motorbike and a car to be used for training at her driving school.
She hopes to be able to open other branches in the near future.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike and a car to be used for training at her driving school.

loan.name: Ding

texts.en:
Ding lives in Bor. She sells food in a stall, and has been in this business for two years. She is 25 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.
Ding heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loan.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loan.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in the Govisumber province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver at a private company. Her elder child studies at college and her younger son studies at the high school in the local area.
Erdenetsetseg started a retail business selling fruit one year ago. She says the business is going really well and is profitable. She has established many regular customers and suppliers. Now she plans to buy supplies in large quantities so she can make more profits to pay for her daughter's college tuition fees.
Erdenetsetseg is an intelligent woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activity by buying supplies wholesale to save on transportation expenses." The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT for the fruit.

loan.use: To purchase more fruit.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has a transportation business. He has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him service his motorbike and also help him pay for his insurance.
He hopes to own a piece of land and build a residential house in the future.

loan.use: To renew the insurance coverage for his motorcycle.

loan.name: Erdenesuren

texts.en: Erdenesuren is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, her elder kid is a college student and her younger one is a school student. In 2005, she started her first business by operating a cafe and she started running her consumer goods retailing business in 2007 at the outdoor market. Her stall location is excellent and her goods are great. Now that her income is increasing, she expanded her shop size. However, she's lacking necessary products to fill the stall. Therefore, she's requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy goods. She's a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my kid made it to college, I have to support him."

loan.use: To buy more consumer products

loan.name: Aker

texts.en:
Aker lives in Bor. She sells charcoal, and she has been in this business for three years. She is 30 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are still in school.
Aker heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan with BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loan.name: Carolina

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Carolina compr un computador y comestibles con los que surti su negocio y le fu muy bien. En la actualidad comprar una impresora multifuncional y realizar cambios de las boards y mantenimiento de sus 5 computadores, para ofrecer cada vez mas un mejor servicio, esta es la razn por la cual est acudiendo a un nuevo credikiva porque cada dia que pasa, con las inversiones su negocio ha crecido y esto es gracias a los financiamientos a travs de Kiva.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Carolina was able to buy a computer and food products to restock her business. As a result, it has done very well. She currently will buy a multifunctional printer, replace the keyboards, and pay for the maintenance of five computers so that each one can provide better service. For this reason, she is asking for a new Kiva loan.

With each passing day, the investment in her business keeps growing thanks to the financing provided through Kiva.

loan.use: to buy a multifunctional printer, replacement keyboards, and pay for computer maintenance.

loan.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de granos, la socia continua comprando quinua, la socia tambien continua vendiendo ollas a pedido y tambien con sus ventas de productos de belleza por catalogo. La socia ene sta ocasion desea invertir su prestamo en la compra de granos ella desea comprar al por mayor quinua, cebada, tarwi, trigo para incrementar sus ventas de cereales naturales, la socia con otra parte invertira en la compra de ollas.
texts.en: Ana Maria keeps on running her activity, buying and selling grains such as quinoa; she also keeps on selling pans by order as well as beauty products by catalogue. In this occasion she wants to invest a part of her loan in the wholesale purchase of grains such as quinoa, barley, tarwi (an Andean variety of lupine) and wheat to increase her sales of natural cereals; another part of her loan will be used to buy pans.

loan.use: To buy pans and dry products such as tarwi, quinoa, barley and wheat.

loan.name: Kibet

texts.en:
Kibet is 26 years old and a resident of Litein in South Rift Kenya. He is a farmer, which he has been doing for eight years. He employs one farmhand. His farm produces tea and milk which he sells to the local market.
Kibet is requesting a loan for 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to buy a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit. He hopes to build a strong foundation for his future family and earn additional income.

loan.use: to purchase a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loan.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de venta de ropa pero no le fue muy bien,pero ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia hace desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueo de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restraurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,pollo,carne y verduras y tambien para comprar cerveza y gaseosa.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She used to sell clothes but didn't do too well in this business so now is in the restaurant business. She makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners and supports her children through this business. Her dream is to expand the restaurant business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook like rice, chicken, meat and vegetables and also to buy beer and soft-drinks. She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loan.use: to buy ingredients to cook and also to buy beer and soft-drinks.

loan.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es: El seor Santos, es soltero, tiene 44 aos de edad, vive en casa de un familiar y se dedica a la Elaboracin y venta de ladrillos, lea, piedra y tierra el cual traslada en su carreta la que es alada por un caballo, ya tiene 9 aos en este negocio donde ya cuenta con clientes fijos que siempre lo buscan para comprarle y ellos lo recomiendan a otras personas, debido a que su caballo ya esta viejo y no quiere maltratarlo, esta solicitando crdito por valor de L. 5,000.00 para la compra de un caballo, su sueo es poder encontrar una persona conquien compartir su vida y poder tener hijos, Espera que Prisma pueda apoyarle.
texts.en: Santos, 44, is single. He lives in a relative's house and works making and selling bricks, firewood, stone and soil which he transports in his horse-drawn cart. He's been in this business for nine years now and has regular customers who always seek him out to buy from him and they recommend him to others. Because his horse is old and he does not want to mistreat him, he's asking for a L.5,000.00 loan to buy a horse; his dream is to find a person to share his life with and to have children. He hopes Prisma will be able to help him.

loan.use: to buy a horse.

loan.name: Maria Xiomara

texts.es: La seora Maria, se dedica a su negocio de Elaboracion y venta de tortillas, desde muy pequea su mama le enseo esta actividad y como no tuvo los medios para estudiar continuo con el negocio, con su compaero de hogar tuvieron varios hijos los cuales gracias al esfuerzo de ambos los sacaron adelante con los estudios, actualmente tiene dos hijas que depende de ella. Su negocio comienza desde muy temprano a las 2:00 am y termina a las 6:00 am ya que a partir de las 7:00 am comienza a entregar las tortillas de manera ambulante es una colonia muy populosa de la ciudad, donde ya cuenta con clientes fijos que le encargan, su hija que estudia por la tarde le ayuda en la entrega de las tortillas. Su sueo es poder comprar un terreno y construir su vivienda y vivir tranquilamente cuando ya no pueda continuar su negocio. Esta solicitando credito por valor de L. 12,000.00 para comprar maiz, lea y cal para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mara makes tortillas to sell. Her mother taught her this activity when she was still little and since she did not have the necessary resources to go to school she continued with the business. She and her spouse have had several children who thanks to both their effort they were able to raise and provide schooling for. She currently has two daughters who still depend on her.
Her business starts very early at 2:00am and ends at 6:00am since starting at 7:00am she goes out to sell her tortillas in an ambulatory fashion in one of the citys most populous neighborhoods where she has regular customers who place orders with her. Her daughter who attends school in the afternoon helps her deliver the tortillas.
Her dream is to be able to buy a piece of land and to build her house to live in peace once shes unable to continue with her business. Shes asking for a L.12,000.00 loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder for her business.

loan.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime powder.

loan.name: Pabla Norma

texts.es: Pabla Norma es una emprendedora que ya ha venido trabajando con Fundacin Len 2000, en el crdito anterior fue para el negocio lo cual la emprendedora nos expresa que con el apoyo ha aumento su mercadera y de igual manera sus clientes. Actualmente la emprendedora est solicitando financiamiento pero en esta ocasin es para realizar algunas remodelaciones a su vivienda, con el crdito comprara perlines, zinc, cemento, arena entre otros materiales de construccin.
texts.en: Pabla Norma is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundacin Len 2000. Her previous loan was for her business and she mentions that it helped her increase merchandise and customers. Currently, she's asking for funding but on this occasion it's to do some home improvements. She will use the loan to buy purlines, metal sheeting, cement and sand, among other building materials and supplies.

loan.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loan.name: Amparo Alexandra

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegra de su gente y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se renen cada quince das las socias del banco comunal Las Piedras.
En este lugar vive la seora Amparo, tiene 26 aos de edad y mantiene una relacin de unin libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 5 aos el mismo que este ao empieza a estudiar en escuela. El marido se dedica a la cra de animales.
Ella junto al esposo se dedican a la cra de pollos para lo cual tienen dos galpones en los cuales cada quince das meten hasta 200 pollos los mismos que los cran y luego los venden a comerciantes que los revenden en distintos mercados de la ciudad, su esposo lleva ms de 8 aos con este negocio que esto les da lo suficiente para salir adelante.
Este crdito lo va a emplear para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los mismos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco.
Su sueo es tener un carro o un camin.
texts.en:
The Las Piedras communal bank meets every two weeks in a neighborhood known as Las Piedras in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo which is known for its traditional culture, the joy of its residents and the feast days of Saints Peter and Paul.
Amparo, 26, lives here. Shes in a common law relationship and has a five-year-old son who will start school this year. Her husband raises animals.
She and her husband raise chickens. They have two sheds for this purpose that they place up to 200 chicks into every two weeks to raise themselves that they later sell to merchants who resell them in various markets in the city. Her husband has been in this business for over 8 years and it produces enough to get ahead.
She will use this loan to buy chicks, feed and medicine for them. Shes been in the communal bank since its founding and she likes it because of the assistance and the benefits she gets from the bank. Her dream is to own a car or a truck.

loan.use: to buy chicks, feed and medicine for them.

loan.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores, vive con su esposo y una hija de 18 aos, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, la tiene en su propia casa, atiende las labores del hogar como ama de casa y al mismo tiempo est pendiente de sus cerdos, este oficio lo aprendi de sus padres. Ella est solicitando un prstamo para la compra de un cerdo y concentrado para alimentar a los dems, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar la granja y a tener seguro el alimento para los mismos cerdos. La aspiracin e Dolores es ampliar la granja, para tener ms oportunidades de ventas, para generar ms ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores lives with her husband and an 18-year-old daughter. She raises pigs for a living, having them in her own house. She attends to the household chores as a housewife and at the same time she takes care of her pigs, a trade she learned from her parents.
She is requesting a loan to buy a pig and pig feed for the other ones. This purchase will help her enlarge the farm and secure the food for the pigs.
Dolores' aspiration is to expand the farm, in order to have more sales opportunities and to generate more income for her family.

loan.use: to buy a pig and pig feed

loan.name: Dolores Elisabeth

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegra de su gente y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se renen cada quince das las socias del banco comunal Las Piedras.
En este lugar conocimos a la seora Dolores, tiene 46 aos de edad, est separada pero de una relacin que tuvo tres hijos, todos mayores de edad que estudian en universidad y aun vive con ella.
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que para salir adelante se dedica a varias actividades, trabaja en un jardn de infantes y tambin se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosmticos, perfumera y accesorios para damas). Trabaja los fines de semana en sus ventas aunque tambin vende en el lugar de trabajo, ella deja sus productos a crdito y cobra cada ocho das. Lleva cinco aos dedicada al comercio y le va muy bien, lo que ms vende son los perfumes tanto de hombres como de mujeres.
Este crdito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosmticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los crditos le han ayudado mucho.
Su sueo es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The Las Piedras communal bank meets every two weeks in a neighborhood known as Las Piedras in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo which is known for its traditional culture, the joy of its residents and the feast days of Saints Peter and Paul.
We got to know Dolores, 46, here. Shes separated but while in a relationship she had three children who are all adults now attending university and still living with her.
She is a very tenacious woman who in order to get ahead carries out a variety of activities. She works in a Kindergarten and also sells Yanbal and Avon brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and womens accessories). She works on her sales during the weekend although she also sells at her place of employment. She sells on credit and collects payment weekly. Shes been in commerce for five years and does very well. What she sells most is perfume both for men and for women.
This loan is to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics. Shes been in the communal bank since its founding and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot. Her dream is that her children complete their studies and become upstanding citizens.

loan.use: to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loan.name: Irene Elalith

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegra de su gente y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se renen cada quince das las socias del banco comunal Las Piedras.
En este lugar vive la seora Irene, tiene 42 aos de edad y mantiene una relacin de unin libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, una mayor de edad y el menor de 16 aos que estudian en universidad y colegio. El marido trabaja en un bus.
Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a vender ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y tambin vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeo local, Trabaja todos los das, deja a crdito sus productos y cobra cada quince das. Su mercadera la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada quince das o cada mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene un ao que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que ms vende es ropa de mujer.
Este crdito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de playa. Est en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda y atencin que le brindan en la institucin.
Su sueo es tener un local comercial para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Las Piedras communal bank meets every two weeks in a neighborhood known as Las Piedras in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo which is known for its traditional culture, the joy of its residents and the feast days of Saints Peter and Paul.
Irene, 42, lives here. Shes in a common law relationship and has two children. One is an adult and the younger one is 16 years old; they attend university and secondary school. Her husband works in a bus.
In order to earn a little on her own, she sells all types of clothes door to door and also at home where she has a small locale. She works every day selling her products on credit and collecting payment every two weeks. She goes to Guayaquil every two weeks or monthly to buy merchandise according to what she needs. Shes been in this activity for a year and does very well; what she sells the most is womens clothes.
She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and beach wear. Shes been in the communal bank since its founding and likes it because of the help and customer service the institution provides her. Her dream is to have a store to sell her products in.

loan.use: to buy clothes.

loan.name: Aura Estela

texts.es: La seora Aura se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 25 aos, comienza muy temprano para ir a moler el maiz y luego comenzar a elaborar las tortillas ya que tiene que entregar varios pedidos a sus clientes quienes le visitan en su casa todos los dias de la semana a partir de las 7:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm, esta casada y tiene tres hijos quienes le ayudan a repartir las tortillas, desde pequea comenzo en esta actividad y gracias a los ingresos obtenidos ha mantenido a sus hijos y le ha realizado mejoras a su vivienda. Esta solicitando credito por valor de L. 12,000.00 para la compra de maiz, lea, cal y como su vivienda es de madera y ya esta daada necesita una parte del prestamo para la compra de madera y hacer el cambio.
texts.en:
Aura makes tortillas to sell, an activity shes been in for 25 years. She starts very early to go grind the corn and start to make tortillas that she has to deliver to several customers who place orders with her and come by her house every day of the week starting at 7am and continuing until 7pm.
Shes married and has three children who help her deliver the tortillas. She started with this activity while still a little girl and thanks to income obtained has been able to support her children and to do some home improvements.
Shes asking for a L. 12,000.00 loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder. Because her house is wood and its in need of repair, she needs part of the loan to buy wood to replace it.

loan.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime powder.

loan.name: Florecitas Group

texts.es: Doa Nolvia Dolores es miembro del Grupo Solidario Florecitas, tiene 36 aos de edad, tiene 6 hijos y algunos aun dependen de ella, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Nolvia inicio hace 4 aos con la venta de ropa, ella est solicitando este prstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropa con estilos que estn a la moda para as poder llamar la atencin de sus clientes y de este modo pueda aumentar sus ventas. Ella comienza a trabajar desde las 6:00 A.M y regresa a las 6:00 P.M, su desventaja es que cuando da al crdito no siempre le pagan puntualmente y que para trasladarse lo hace a jaln, ya que sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante. Sus metas es tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijos a cubrir los gastos estudiantiles. Nolvia es clienta de FAMA desde hace varios ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Nolvia Dolores is a member of the "Florecitas" solidarity group. She is 36 years old, has 6 children and some of them are still dependent on her. Her husband works in agriculture.
Four years ago Nolvia started selling clothes. She is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing clothes in fashionable styles, in order to call draw customers' attention. In this way she could increase her sales. She starts working at 6:00am and returns home at 6:00pm.
Her disadvantage is that when she sells on credit, they don't always pay her on time. And as she is does door to door sales, she has to catch a ride.
Her objective is to have more revenue, in order to help her children cover school expenses. Nolvia has been a client of FAMA for several loan cycles and she has cleared her payments on time.

loan.use: to buy clothes

loan.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is 29 years old. He is from Nakuru and is married to Alice; they have two children who are both in school.
Arthur is a farmer and has been one for the past 12 years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd., to enable him buy water pipes and chemicals.
He hopes to diversify into cattle rearing in the future.

loan.use: To buy water pipes and chemicals

loan.name: Allamine Group

texts.fr: ALLAMINE est un groupe de lassociation BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe 6 femmes qui se sont connues travers des liens de parent et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne dge de 30 ans. Maries et ayant trois enfants, elles mnent diffrentes activits telles lachat vente de condiment alimentaire et des habillement et de la restauration limage de KODIE, assise gauche. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles TIELE une des communes de la sous prfecture de BAGUINEDA (Rgion de Koulikoro, Rpublique du Mali). Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs annes et sont trs sollicites dans leurs activits. Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientle, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Elles sont leur cinquime prt solidaire. KODIE est trs connue TIELE et excelle dans lachat vente de la viande. Elle compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, une quantit importante de viande auprs des bouchers de TIELE pour revendre dans son restaurant sous forme de steak, de brochette et de ragot, en dtail, au comptant, une clientle compose dhomme et de femmes. Elle espre sur un bnfice mensuel de 50000FCFA somme qui lui permettra de rembourser le prt et de rinvestir dans son activit.
texts.en:
Allamine is a group in the Benkadi association in Tiele. It is made up of 6 women who are all friends and relatives. They are all married, have an average age of 30 and 3 children on average. They are involved in various businesses such as buying and selling food supplies and clothing, and the restaurant business, like Kodie, who is sitting on the left.
The group members live in large traditional families in Tiele, a town in the Baguineda sub-prefecture (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have been involved in small-scale business for several years and are much sought-after in their respective businesses. In order to satisfy the growing demands of customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan programme three years ago. This is their fifth solidarity loan.
Kodie is well-known in Tiele and very good at buying and selling meat. She will use the loan to buy a large quantity of meat from butchers in Tiele to resell in her restaurant as steak, kebab and stew. She sells to individuals for cash, and her customers are men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loan.use: to buy meat.

loan.name: Mercedes Jacoba

texts.es: Mercedes, de 50 aos de edad habita en la comunidad Momotombo en las afueras de Len , casada, madre de tres hijos . Ella es comerciante y agricultora. Inicio con sus actividades cuando se caso. Su esposo le enseo a comercializar los productos que el sembrar asi como tambin el cuido de los animales y asi poco a poco fue aprendiendo del negocio con el que mantiene a su familia. Una de las actividades que mas le gusta es la crianza de animales en especial la de cerdos. Es por ello que solicita el crdito para compra de 4 cerdos reproductores y de desarrollo pues una actividad agrcola que deja buenas ganancias. A ella le gustara tener bien establecido un buen numero de cerdos reproductores y de raza para venderlo en sectores cercanos a su comunidad adems de poder invertir en las siembras de maz. Pues su prioridad es darle una educacin profesional a sus hijos
texts.en:
Mercedes, 50, lives in the community of Momotombo in the outskirts of Len; shes married and the mother of three children. Shes a merchant and a farmer. She started her activities when she got married. Her husband taught her how to sell the products he grows as well as to care for animals. Thus she gradually learned the business she supports her family with.
One of the activities she likes most is raising animals, especially pigs. Its because of this that shes asking for a loan to buy four breeding pigs because this is an agricultural activity that produces good profits. Shed like to have a good number of breeding, pedigree pigs to sell in sectors near her community and to be able to invest in corn crops. Her priority is to provide her children with professional education.

loan.use: to buy pigs.

loan.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es: El seor Jess de 48 aos de edad es soltero con 5 hijos de 23, 22, 18,15 y 31 aos de edad todos trabajan en la agricultura. Inicio sus actividades desde pequeo con su pap. A la edad de 21 aos se fue independizado de sus padres, su nivel acadmico es bien bsico solo curso el primer grado de primaria a pesar de ello aprendi a leer y escribir bien, este ha sido siempre su nico trabajo su producto lo comercializa en su comunidad no tiene otros ingresos.Su expectativas es sembrar adems de maz de riego, sembrar hortalizas pues le va ayudar a crecer en su negocio. Por esta razn est solicitando el crdito para compra de insumos y fertilizantes para sembrar maz y hortalizas. Ya que con un buen mantenimiento en sus cultivos espera una produccin de muy buenos rendimientos y calidad. El junto con sus hijos son trabajadoress que con sus esfuerzos propios ha sacado adelante la finca
texts.en: Jess, 48, is single and has five children who are 23, 22, 18, 15 and 31 years old; they all work in agriculture. He started his activities while still little with his father. At the age of 21 he started to become independent from his parents. His academic level is pretty basic; he only completed first grade in elementary school but despite that has learned to read and write well. This has always been his only work. He sells his products in his community and has no other source of income. His hope is to plant more corn and vegetables because it will help his business grow. Because of this hes asking for the loan to buy supplies and fertilizer to plant corn and vegetables because with good crop care he expects very good, high quality crop yields. He and his children are hardworking and have made their farm successful with their own efforts.

loan.use: to buy farm supplies.

loan.name: Nyagaach

texts.en:
Nyagaach lives in Bor. She sells food from a stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school.
Nyagaach heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese Pounds (SDG) in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loan.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of Kitale where he lives with his family of four children aged between 21 and 7, all of whom are in school save for the first born. He has been in active farming for 10 years and has a retail shop business as well to supplement the farming income. His farm is run with the help of one farmhand and produces horticultural products and poultry.
Peter has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help him boost the poultry business by buying more birds. He says additional birds will increase his income and make it easier to provide for the family's basic needs. He aspires to specialize in the poultry business.
He laments of high cost of production and unreliable rains.

loan.use: To buy poultry

loan.name: Ajith

texts.en:
Ajith lives in Bor. She sells food from a stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school.
Ajith heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2500 Sudanese Pounds (SDG) in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loan.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru and this will be his second loan. He used his first loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. He was able to plant and harvest and it was very profitable. He plans to buy more fertilizer and seedlings as well as spraying chemicals for use in his farm.
In the future, Joseph hopes to start large scale farming and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loan.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loan.name: Akuol

texts.en:
Akuol is 33 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She lives in Bor and sells charcoal, which she has been doing business for one year.
Akuol is requesting her third loan from BRAC for 2,500 SDG, which she will use to purchase charcoal. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Bolodobolo Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes du groupe BOLODOBOLO ont en moyenne vingt neuf ans, deux enfants et vivent dans des familles, nuclaire TIELE commune,de la sous prfecture de BAGUINEDA, relevant de Koulikoro (2me rgion administrative du Mali). Elles sont leur deuxime collaboration avec linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poissons, d habillements, riz, savons limage de KADIA qui la premire gauche Elle compte acheter avec son prt, vingt cartons de savons. ELLE sapprovisionne a BAMAKO effectue sa vente, au march de TIELE et a domicile une clientle compose dhommes et de femmes, en dtail, au comptant et crdit. Elle envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel moyen de 15000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilise pour lappui de son mari dans les dpenses quotidiennes et lautre partie sera investie dans les activits.
texts.en:
The 5 women in the Bolodobolo group are 29 years old on average, have an average of two children and live in nuclear families in Tiele, a town in the Baguineda sub-prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali). This is their second collaboration with the microfinance institute Soro Yiriwaso in order to help them satisfy their customer's needs.
The women in the group sell items such as fish, clothing, rice or soap, like Kadia, pictured first on the left. With her loan, Kadia will buy 20 boxes of soap. She buys her supplies in Bamako and sells them at the market in Tiele or door-to-door. Her customers include men and women and they buy with cash or on credit. Kadia is hoping to make an average of 15,000 CFA francs per month, part of which will support her husband in paying daily expenses and part of which will be reinvested in the business.

loan.use: to buy soap.

loan.name: Maria

texts.fr: Madame MARIA est une femme marie de 38 ans avec trois enfants et qui habitent Oulssbougou (sous prfecture de la deuxime rgion du Mali) situe 80 kilomtres de Bamako. Madame MARIA quitta lcole trs tt pour des raisons de mariage, elle intgra le programme de prt de groupe de Soro Yiriwaso pour mieux entreprendre la vente de boissons en ambulant. Elle est son quatrime prt aprs avoir correctement rembourss tous les trois prcdents. Avec ce prt elle compte constituer un stock important de boissons avec 700 casiers afin de faire une longue priode sans rupture. Elle est approvisionne sur place par ses fournisseurs. Elle envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel 200.000 FCFA quelle utilisera pour le paiement de ses chances et subvenir ses dpenses quotidiennes. Madame MARIA ambitionne dans les jours venir, avec lappui de Soro Yiriwaso ouvrir un sous dpts de boissons pour faire la vente en gros.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives in Oulssbougou (a sub-prefecture of the 2nd administrative region of Mali), which is 80 km from Bamako.
Maria left school very early due to marriage, and she is involved in the Soro Yiriwaso loan programme in order to improve her business selling drinks as an itinerant vendor. This is her fourth loan, and she has repaid all the others in full. With this loan she hopes to restock her business, buying 700 racks of drinks in order to be well-supplied for a long period of time. Her suppliers deliver directly to her.
Maria is expecting a monthly profit of 200,000 CFA francs, which she will use for repayments and daily costs. In the future, she hopes to be able to open a larger drinks store in order to sell in bulk.

loan.use: to buy drinks.

loan.name: Pan De Azcar (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Pan de Azcar est formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador" y la ciudad cultural del pas. Cuenca es una ciudad con mucha produccin artesanal. Su gente es amable, clida y gentil como nuestras socias quienes se dedican a laborar en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ayudar y solventar los gastos de sus hogares.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Seora. Jesenia, tiene 19 aos, es casada y aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
La Seora. Jesenia se dedica a la venta de cosmticos por catalogo, actividad que la desempea hace 4 aos, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
Se encuentra en el segundo crdito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra cosmticos para ampliar su mercadera.
Su meta es culminar sus estudios secundarios.
La foto pequea adjunta es de una de las socias que por motivos personales no pudo estar presente cuando se tom la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The "Pan de Azcar" ["Sugarloaf"] communal bank is made up of 6 women and one man, who live in the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay province. Cuenca is known as the "Athens of Ecuador" and as the country's cultural city. Cuenca is also a city with a high level of handicraft production. Its people are friendly, warm and polite, as are our members, who work at various activities which allow them to supplement or cover the expenses of their households.
One of the members of this group is Jesenia, who is 19 years old. She is married and as yet has no children. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not have a house of their own, so they live in rented quarters.
Jesenia works selling cosmetics from a catalog. She has done this work for 4 years. She works from Sunday to Sunday without fixed working hours.
She is in her second loan cycle with the communal bank, and she will invest the loan in buying cosmetics to expand her stock of merchanadise.
Her goal is to finish her secondary education.
The small photo attached is of one of the members who could not be present when the group photo was taken, for personal reasons.

loan.use: to buy cosmetics.

loan.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham, a 48-year-old married father of three children, two of whom are of school-going age, has been in farming for nearly 20 years, producing milk and maize for the local market. He says low production during dry seasons and animal diseases are his major business challenges.

Abraham has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. He says the income generated will go into providing for family's basic needs and educating the children. He hopes to own a van and start a transport business mainly delivering farmers' produce to the local market.

loan.use: to buy poultry.

loan.name: Aguer

texts.en: Aguer, a 30-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom attend school, lives in Bor where she has been operating a food stall for three years. Aguer, who heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, is now requesting her third loan for 1500 SDG to purchase onions and rice to sell. She will use the resulting extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loan.use: to purchase onions and rice for resale.

loan.name: Elispha

texts.en:
Elispha is 29 years old and married to James. Together they have three children. She sells air time calling cards and has been in the business for the past six months.
This is her first term loan. She was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET LTD client. She will use the loan amount to purchase more air time calling cards for stock in her business.
Her hope is to establish her business in her own premises.

loan.use: to purchase more air time calling cards

loan.name: Mara Rossana

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegra de su gente y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se renen cada quince das las socias del banco comunal Las Piedras.
En este lugar conocimos a la seora Mara, tiene 33 aos de edad, est casada y de esta relacin tienen tres hijos de 12, 6 y 2 aos de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosmticos, perfumera y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres das a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias y sobre todo en las maanas que sus hijos estn en la escuela, ella solo tiene que llevar al ms pequeo ya que no tiene con quien dejarlo pero esto no le impide realizar sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crdito y cobra cada ocho das. Tiene un ao que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crdito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosmticos y ropa por catalogo ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Es fundadora del banco Comunal y le gusta porque los crditos son muy importantes en su negocio.
Su sueo es tener una boutique.
En la foto est la socia con su hijo.
texts.en:
In an area known as Las Piedras of Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo--known for its traditional culture, the happiness of its people, and its San Pedro and San Pablo festivals--the members of the communal bank Las Piedras gather every two weeks.
Here we meet Mara, who is 33 years old and married. From this marriage, she has three children, who are 12, 6, and 2 years old. The two oldest children are studying in high school and elementary school. Her husband is a driver.
She is a homemaker who, in order to have her own resources and with those help her husband with the household expenses, sells catalog clothing and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She sells door-to-door. She works three days a week for two to three hours a day, especially in the mornings when her children are in school. She only has to carry her youngest, as she does not have anyone with whom she can leave him. But this does not keep her from making her rounds, dropping off her products, and collecting every week. She has been doing this trade for a year, and it is going well.
This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and catalog clothing, as she has several orders to deliver. She is the founder of the communal bank and would like the loan because loans are very important to her business.
Her dream is to have a boutique.
She is shown in the photo with her son.

loan.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics y clothing.

loan.name: Javzanpagma

texts.en:
Javzanpagma, a 34-year-old hardworking woman, lives with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in a ger district which lacks basic infrastructure in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver for a local gas company, having previously worked for a public transportation company for nine years.

Javzanpagma started her business in 2005 by selling building materials at Tsaiz, the largest outdoor wood market in Mongolia, with a working capital of 2,000,000 MNT. She buys raw materials from a wood truck which comes from the countryside, and as a result of her hard work, she now has working capital of 7,800,000 MNT.

Javzanpagma is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy more wood for the upcoming season. Her business is very popular during the summer time, so she wants to purchase more wood as a reserve. Javzanpagma wants her children to get an excellent education and her goal for the upcoming year is to build a new small house for her family. A repeat and trusted client, she is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to improve her business.

loan.use: to purchase wood for the upcoming season.

loan.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 47 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She is from Olkalou and is a farmer, which she has been doing for 10 years.
Lucy is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides. She hopes to boost her farming business and get a good harvest.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides.

loan.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Soeng is a widow and has one son. She lives with her mother on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.
Soeng is a silk weaver as is her mother. She is requesting a loan for $300, which she will use to purchase silk materials.

loan.use: to purchase weaving materials for her silk weaving business.

loan.name: Nyandeng

texts.en:
Nyandeng is 37 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom attend school. She lives in Bor and sells charcoal, which she has been doing for four years.
Nyandeng is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC for 2,500 SDG, which she will use to buy charcoal. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Gladis Asuncin

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegra de su gente y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se renen cada quince das las socias del banco comunal Las Piedras.
En este lugar conocimos a la seora Gladis, tiene 46 aos de edad, est casada y de esta relacin tienen cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 17 aos que son mellizos y estudian en colegio y son los que aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos Avon y Yanbal (artculos de belleza, cosmticos perfumera y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los das ms que todo en las horas de la maana ya que a esas horas le resulta ms fcil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja a crdito y cobra semanalmente, esto lo viene realizando desde hace tres aos en los cuales le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela, lo que ms vende son los cosmticos y los perfumes.
Este crdito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutera, cosmticos, cremas y ropa. Est en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los crditos para salir adelante.
Su sueo es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Piedras communal bank meet every two weeks in a sector known as Las Piedras in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. The city is known for its traditional culture, its joyful people, and the San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas.
This is where we meet Gladis, age 46. She is married and has four children. Two of them are adults, and the two 17 year olds are twins. They go to school and still live with her. Her husband is a driver.
She sells clothes and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and womens accessories). She works every day, mostly in the mornings. This is because that is when it is easier for her to go along her route. She sells door-to-door and by order. She leaves products on credit, and she charges weekly.
She has been doing this for three years, and it has gone very well for her. She has plenty of customers. She sells cosmetics and perfumes the most.
She will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and clothes. She has been in the communal bank since it started. She likes it for the help they give with the loans in order to get ahead.
Her dream is to see her children finish their education and that they become good professionals.

loan.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and clothes.

loan.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is single and has been in the transportation business for the last two years. Emmanuel had a friend who hired him a motorcycle. From this, he was able to raise funds to purchase a motorcycle, which brings him funds on a daily basis.
Emmanuel learned of Milango from his friends and decided to join in order to access credit for his business. He is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to repair the motorcycle and open a grocery stall.
The current business faces challenges due to high fuel cost and competition from other motorcycle operators for the existing clients. This is the main reason which has prompted him to start another business. Emmanuel believes the extra income from this loan will help him enroll in an electrical course.

loan.use: to repair his motorcycle and open a grocery stall

loan.name: Matilde Alida

texts.en:
Matilde, age 39, is a single mother with two school-age children. She also cares for her nephew, whose parents are not able to support him.
She initially started a business selling oil, milk, and soap. She had this business for seven years. Since she started receiving loans, she has been able to expand to a more profitable product. She now sells drinks in glass bottles. This is how most soft drinks and beer are sold in the Republic of Congo. Customers return the glass bottles to her and receive a discount on their next purchase of drinks. She will use the loan to buy more glass bottles and drinks for her business.
Her greatest challenge is the initial cost of the expensive glass bottles and the transportation costs associated with carrying very heavy glass bottles. She hopes to one day grow her business large enough to purchase a vehicle to aid in transporting bottles. Her business strategy is to stock a large variety of drinks. She feels this has helped her acquire many customers.
Matilde has received three previous loans from Kiva's partner HOPE Congo. She has a very good repayment record. She is grateful for the loans and hopes that the money she is now able to save will help her children to become educated and successful.

loan.use: to pay for glass bottles and drinks

loan.name: Ma. Brigida

texts.es: La seora Ma. Brigida, desde muy pequea inico en el negocio ya que no tuvo los recursos para poder estudiar tenia que ayudar con los ingresos de su casa, actualmente vive con su hija y un nieto, es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora, desde hace 23 aos que se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitacion, comienzan desde las 6:00 am cuando va al molino para preparar la masa y con la ayuda de su hija trabajan juntas para poder cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes de restaurantes, pulperias y personas que la visitan en su negocio, su sueo es poder ver a su nieto graduado de la universidad y que pueda tener las oportunidades que ella no pudo. Esta solicitando credito por valor de L. 12,000.00 para la compra de maiz, lea, cal y como su vivienda es de madera, necesita una parte del credito para la compra de cemento para realizarle unas mejoras y poder ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mara Brigida started in the business when she was very young. She did not have the resources to be able to go to school. She had to help with the household income.
She currently lives with her daughter and a grandson. She is a very humble and hard-working woman. She has been making and selling tortillas in her house for 23 years. She starts at 6:00 a.m. when she goes to the mill to prepare the dough. Her daughter helps her, and they work together to fill her customers orders. She has orders from restaurants, grocery stores, and people who visit her business. Her dream is to be able to see her grandson graduate from the university. She wants to see him be able to have the opportunities that she was not able to have.
She is requesting a loan for 12,000 lempiras to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder. She has a wooden house, so she needs part of the loan to buy cement to make some improvements. She wants to be able to offer her family better living conditions.

loan.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for her business.

loan.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 46 years old and married to Catherine. Together they have two school-going children. He operates a shop selling cereals in Naivasha.
Simon was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and he plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of assorted cereals to sell.
In the future, Simon hopes to open other cereal shops in Naivasha, thereby making more income and improving the living standards of his family.

loan.use: to buy more cereals

loan.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is married with four children. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand his planting area to get more output and pay school fees for the children.
In the background of the picture, there is a group of agriculture borrowers sitting behind Jean Damascene. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and labor support

loan.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has five children. Uba is a dairy farmer. She started her dairy business seven years ago. She bought a female calf, which has grown and given birth. She also engages in tree planting, a common business gaining acceptance within Malindi.
She was introduced to Milango last year by her friends, and she is now applying for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase animal feeds and to buy more trees for planting. The high transportation cost has been the major challenge for Uba. The additional income will help her meet emergency needs.

loan.use: To purchase animal feeds and trees

loan.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: La seora Erlinda, es soltera y vive con una nieta, siempre le ha gustado el negocio y desde hace 40 aos que se dedica a su Pulpera donde vende variedad de productos como ser, arroz, frijoles, azcar, huevos, caf, pan, leche, papel higinico, jabn, refrescos y otros, atiende a sus clientes todos los das de la semana, sus clientes la prefieren por su buen trato ya que es muy amable y siempre esta sonriendo, realiza sus compras una vez por semana en el mercado de la comunidad. Esta solicitando crdito por valor de L. 20,000.00 para la compra de variedad de productos para su negocio y as poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, Gracias a los ingresos que recibe de su negocio ha logrado hacerle varias mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Erlinda is single and lives with a granddaughter. She has always enjoyed business and has had her grocery store for 40 years, where she sells a variety of products such as rice, beans, sugar, eggs, coffee, bread, milk, toilet paper, soap, beverages and other items. She waits on customers every day of the week. Her customers come to her because of her good service since she is very friendly and always smiling. She makes her purchases once a week at the market in her community.
She is seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000.00 HNL for the purchase of a range of products for her business in order to be able to offer variety to her customers. Thanks to her income from her business she has been able to make a number of improvements to her home.

loan.use: to purchase beans, sugar, coffee, soap, milk, oil, eggs and other items for her business.

loan.name: Alek

texts.en:
Alek lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children. Two of them are still in school.
Alek heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loan.name: Xiomara Elizabeth

texts.es: Xiomara, vive con su esposo y un hijo, se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene ms de un ao de tener el negocio, inicio con la ayuda de su madre, con este ha logrado tener ms ingresos para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando un prstamo para la compra de aceite, condimentos, arroz, carne, pollo, frijoles, pastas, gaseosas, para poder elaborar los platillos y mejorar la atencin a la clientela. La aspiracin de Xiomara es que con este prstamo se pueda mejorar la produccin en el negocio y atender ms clientes.
texts.en:
Xiomara lives with her husband and son. She makes a living selling food, and has had the business for over a year. She started out with her mothers help. With this, she has been successful in increasing her income in order to help her husband with the household expenses.
She is requesting a loan to buy oil, condiments, rice, meat, chicken, beans, pasta and soda pop in order to be able to make dishes and improve customer service. Xiomaras aspiration is that with this loan she can increase the business output and serve more customers.

loan.use: to buy oil, condiments, rice, meat, chicken, beans, pasta and soda pop.

loan.name: Calle Bolvar (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle Bolvar se rene cada quince das en el Cantn Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesana que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este es un grupo de 9 socias y 2 socios que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los crditos que recibieron pudieron mejorar en algo sus negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, artesana, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la seora Rosa, tiene 34 aos de edad, mantiene una relacin de unin libre y de esa relacin tiene cuatro hijos de 16, 13, 7 y 4 aos de edad, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido es maestro en soldadura.
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja de viernes a domingo ya que en estos das es cuando encuentra a sus clientes y es cuando ms vende, tambin realiza los cobros en estos das ya que deja a crdito y cobra por semana. Su mercadera la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Lleva ms de cinco aos dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien y ahora mejor desde que est recibiendo los crditos.
Este crdito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de nios. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado para seguir adelante y aumentar su negocio.
Su sueo es seguir aumentando sus ventas.
La foto pequea es de una de las socias que por motivos personales no pudo estar presente cuando se tom la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Calle Bolvar communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Cantn. The canton is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are known on a national and international level. It is the home of the famous Panama hat.
This is a group of nine members and two other members who decided to join together to form this communal bank. The bank has served them well because they were able to improve their businesses with the loans that they received. The members devote themselves to different business activities like general commerce, handicrafts, services, food sales, and other businesses.
Rosa is one of the members of this group. She is 34 years old and in a common-law marriage. She has four children, ages 16, 13, 7, and 4. The three oldest go to high school and elementary school. Her husband is a master welder.
She is a very good housewife. In order to help her husband with the household expenses she sells all types of clothes. She sells door-to-door. She works from Fridays through Sundays because this is when she can meet with her customers, and it is when she sells the most. She also collects on these days because she leaves clothes on credit and collects weekly. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise each time she needs it. She has been doing this business activity for over five years. It has gone very well for her. Now it is better since she is receiving the loans.
This loan is to buy pants, t shirts, blouses, and childrens clothes. She has been in the communal bank since it started, and she likes it because of the help it has offered her in order to get ahead and increase her business. Her dream is to continue increasing her sales.
The small photo is of one of the members who for personal reasons was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loan.use: to buy pants, t shirts, blouses, and childrens clothes.

loan.name: Alexandra Flor

texts.es:
Alexandra Flor tiene 23 aos es soltera vive sus padres, no tiene hijos. Vive en Montalvo Provincia de Los Ros.
